D. Monkey

  • Online Judge: 1623
  • Author: 林律穎

Problem Description

PDF

給定二元樹的中序、後序，以及樹上每個節點的權重，求葉節點的權重總合。

Given the inorder and postorder traversal sequences of a binary tree, along with the weights of each node on the tree. Please find the total sum of weights of the leaf nodes.

  • 1≤n≤2000000.

Chinese Editorial

重建二元樹

先備知識：有前序、中序、後序遍歷任兩者，則可以還原出唯一的二元樹。

當我們要重建一棵二元樹時，可以使用中序遍歷和後序遍歷序列來實現。

中序遍歷是指按照「左子樹 - 根節點 - 右子樹」的順序遍歷二元樹，可以幫助我們確定樹中節點的相對位置。

後序遍歷是指按照「左子樹 - 右子樹 - 根節點」的順序遍歷二元樹，因此後序遍歷序列的最後一個節點即為樹的根節點。

基於這些特性，我們可以按照以下步驟，以遞迴的方式來重建二元樹：

  1. 從後序中取出最後一個節點，這個節點是樹的根節點。
  2. 在中序中找到根節點的位置，這樣我們就可以確定左子樹和右子樹的節點數量。
  3. 創建一個樹節點，設置其權重為根節點的權重，並根據中序的 index mapping 做切分，遞迴處理左子樹和右子樹。
  4. 重複以上步驟，直到所有節點都被處理完畢，樹就被完全重建。
範例程式碼 
int tree(int l, int r, int l2, int r2) {
    if(r < l) return -1;
    int root = post[r2];
    int rootid = pos[root];
    left__[root] = tree(l, rootid-1, l2, l2-l+rootid-1);
    right__[root] = tree(rootid+1, r, r2-r+rootid, r2-1);
    return root;
}

// Index mapping
for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) pos[in[i]] = i;

// Construct tree
tree(0, n-1, 0, n-1);

計算葉節點權重總和

當成功重建了二元樹之後，我們需要計算葉節點的權重總和。

  1. 我們可以使用遞迴的方式來遍歷二元樹，從根節點開始。
  2. 對於每個節點，我們檢查它是否為葉節點（即左子節點和右子節點均為 None）。
  3. 如果節點是葉節點，我們將其權重添加到總和中。
  4. 如果節點不是葉節點，我們遞迴處理其左子樹和右子樹，直到所有節點都被檢查完畢。
範例程式碼 
long long sum;
void traval(int i) {
    if(i == -1) return;
    if(left__[i] == -1 && right__[i] == -1) sum += b[i];
    traval(left__[i]);
    traval(right__[i]);
}

// Travel from root
travel(pos[n-1]);

完成以上兩步驟就能解決這題。

整合版

另外，你也可以在建立二元樹的同時判斷是否為葉節點。這樣可以減少過程中的重複遍歷。

在重建二元樹的過程中，當我們創建每個節點時，可以同時檢查它是否為葉節點。如果一個節點沒有左子節點和右子節點，那麼它就是一個葉節點。在這種情況下，我們可以計算並存儲其權重。

範例程式碼 
int tree(int l, int r, int l2, int r2) {
    if(r < l) return -1;
    int root = post[r2];
    int rootid = pos[root];
    int lval = tree(l, rootid-1, l2, l2-l+rootid-1);
    int rval = tree(rootid+1, r, r2-r+rootid, r2-1);
    if (lval == -1 && rval == -1) sum += b[root];
    return root;
}

English Editorial

Reconstructing the Binary Tree

Prerequisite Knowledge: Given any two of the preorder, inorder, and postorder traversals, a unique binary tree can be reconstructed.

When we need to reconstruct a binary tree, we can use the inorder and postorder traversal sequences to achieve this.

Inorder traversal follows the order of "left subtree - root node - right subtree," and it helps us determine the relative positions of nodes in the tree.

Postorder traversal follows the order of "left subtree - right subtree - root node." Therefore, the last node in the postorder traversal sequence is the root node of the tree.

Based on these characteristics, we can reconstruct the binary tree recursively using the following steps:

  1. Take the last node from the postorder traversal, which becomes the root node of the tree.
  2. Find the position of the root node in the inorder traversal, allowing us to determine the number of nodes in the left subtree and the right subtree.
  3. Create a tree node and set its weight as the weight of the root node. Divide the inorder traversal using index mapping and recursively process the left subtree and right subtree.
  4. Repeat the above steps until all nodes have been processed, and the tree is completely reconstructed.
Sample Code 
int tree(int l, int r, int l2, int r2) {
    if(r < l) return -1;
    int root = post[r2];
    int rootid = pos[root];
    left__[root] = tree(l, rootid-1, l2, l2-l+rootid-1);
    right__[root] = tree(rootid+1, r, r2-r+rootid, r2-1);
    return root;
}

// Index mapping
for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) pos[in[i]] = i;

// Construct tree
tree(0, n-1, 0, n-1);

Calculating the Sum of Leaf Node Weights

Once the binary tree has been successfully reconstructed, we need to calculate the sum of leaf node weights.

  1. We can traverse the binary tree using a recursive approach, starting from the root node.
  2. For each node, we check whether it is a leaf node (i.e., it has no left and right child nodes).
  3. If the node is a leaf node, we add its weight to the sum.
  4. If the node is not a leaf node, we recursively process its left subtree and right subtree until all nodes have been checked.
Sample Code 
long long sum;
void traval(int i) {
    if(i == -1) return;
    if(left__[i] == -1 && right__[i] == -1) sum += b[i];
    traval(left__[i]);
    traval(right__[i]);
}

// Travel from root
travel(pos[n-1]);

Completing these two steps will solve the problem.

Integrated Version

Additionally, you can determine whether a node is a leaf node while constructing the binary tree. This approach reduces the need for repeated traversals.

During the process of reconstructing the binary tree, when creating each node, we can simultaneously check whether it is a leaf node. If a node has no left child and right child, it is a leaf node. In this case, we can calculate and store its weight.

Sample Code 
int tree(int l, int r, int l2, int r2) {
    if(r < l) return -1;
    int root = post[r2];
    int rootid = pos[root];
    int lval = tree(l, rootid-1, l2, l2-l+rootid-1);
    int rval = tree(rootid+1, r, r2-r+rootid, r2-1);
    if (lval == -1 && rval == -1) sum += b[root];
    return root;
}

Solutions

Solution in O(n) 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
#include <iostream>
#define maxn 2000005
using namespace std;

int n, in[maxn], post[maxn], pos[maxn];
long long b[maxn];

long long sum;
int tree(int l, int r, int l2, int r2) {
    if(r < l) return -1;
    int root = post[r2];
    int rootid = pos[root];
    int lval = tree(l, rootid-1, l2, l2-l+rootid-1);
    int rval = tree(rootid+1, r, r2-r+rootid, r2-1);
    if (lval == -1 && rval == -1) sum += b[root];
    return root;
}

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);cout.tie(0);
    cin >> n;
    for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) cin >> b[i];
    for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) cin >> in[i], in[i]--;
    for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) cin >> post[i], post[i]--;

    // index mapping
    for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) pos[in[i]] = i;

    // construct tree
    tree(0, n-1, 0, n-1);

    cout << post[n-1]+1 << '\n' << sum << '\n';
    return 0;
}

E. Binary Exponentiation

  • Online Judge: 1624
  • Problem Author: SorahISA
  • Editorial Author: SorahISA、成俊宏

Problem Description

PDF

Please calculate ⌊kxy​⌋modp. There are t testcases.

  • 1≤t≤100000.
  • 1≤x,y,k,p≤109.

Chinese Editorial

k=1 --- Binary Exponentiation

課堂上有教過如何在 O(logy) 的時間內計算 xymodp，這題在 k=1 時，可以直接套用這個方法。

把這題的標題「Binary Exponentiation」放到 Google 搜尋也能找到許多相關的教學文章。

快速冪的具體概念就是將 f(y):=xy 拆成 重複的子問題 遞迴解決，觀察到 f(y)=f(a)⋅f(y−a)：

f(y)={f(⌊y/2⌋)⋅f(⌊y/2⌋)f(⌊y/2⌋)⋅f(⌊y/2⌋)⋅f(1)​if y is even,if y is odd.​

顯然不需要遞迴兩次重複計算一樣的 f(⌊y/2⌋)，所以可以先 將其記錄下來 以便直接取用。

快速冪－遞迴版本 
int fpow(int base, int exp, int mod) {
    if (exp == 0) return 1 % mod;
    int half = fpow(base, exp/2, mod);
    // return half * half % mod * (exp & 1 ? base : 1) % mod;
    if (exp % 2 == 0)
        return half * half % mod;
    else /// remember to take mod to reduce the maximum value during calculation ///
        return half * half % mod * base % mod;
    /*                     ^^^^^                                                  */
}

以下再介紹一個不依賴遞迴的實作方式。

這個實作方式利用到了 y 的 二進位表示法 ∑i=0∞​2ibi​，其中 bi​∈{0,1}，這樣就可以將 f(y) 拆成 ∏i=0∞​f(2ibi​)。

在 C++ 可以使用 y & (1 << i) 來取得 bi​，而 y >> i 可以取得 ⌊y/2i⌋。以下範例程式碼的實作方式是不斷將次方項用 >>= 1 除以二之後以 & 1 來取出「個位數」的值。

快速冪－二進制版本 
int fpow(int base, int exp, int mod) {
    int ans = 1 % mod;
    while (exp) {
        if (exp & 1) ans = ans * base % mod;
        exp >>= 1, base = base * base % mod;
    }
    return ans;
}

滿分解 1 --- 將 x 表達成 ak+q 的形式

要達到滿分，需要得出一個重要的觀察：

k 的倍數部分被模 p 也沒差，但如果餘數部分被模 p，就會無法產生正確的貢獻。

不妨將待相乘的數字表達成 ⟨a,q⟩，代表 ak+q，其中 0≤q<k。觀察兩組數字 ⟨a,q⟩ 跟 ⟨b,r⟩ 相乘的結果：

(ak+q)(bk+r)=abk2+(ar+bq)k+qr=(abk+ar+bq)k+qr(1-1)

這樣我們就能將 ⟨a,q⟩⋅⟨b,r⟩ 表示成 ⟨(abk+ar+bq)modp,qr⟩ 了！

而最後的結果 ⟨a′,q′⟩ 的答案就是 (a′+⌊kq′​⌋)modp。

不過，當 k>2 時，q′ 可能會變得超級大，我們勢必也需要在計算中對餘數做些處理。

而餘數可以再次表示成 ck+s 的形式貢獻到商裡面，所以 (1-1) 可以再變成如下算式：

(abk+ar+bq)k+qr=(abk+ar+bq+⌊kqr​⌋)k+(qrmodk)(1-2)

也就是說，

⟨a,q⟩⋅⟨b,r⟩=⟨(abk+ar+bq+⌊kqr​⌋)modp,qrmodk⟩

如此一來，我們也保證了餘數會在 [0,k) 的範圍內，兩數相乘也不會超出 64-bit 整數的範圍。

滿分解 2 --- 改變模數

首先，考慮如何計算 ⌊ka​⌋modp，即 ⌊ka​⌋ 除以 p 的餘數。

假設 ⌊ka​⌋ 除以 p 的商是 q、⌊ka​⌋ 除以 p 的餘數是 r，所求為 r。

⌊ka​⌋=qp+r(2-1)

根據除法定理，我們有

a=⌊ka​⌋⋅k+(amodk)(2-2)

將 (2-1) 代入 (2-2)：

a​=(qp+r)⋅k+(amodk)=qpk+rk+(amodk)​

為了得到 r，注意到

a≡rk+(amodk)(modpk)

由於 rk+(amodk)<rk+k=(r+1)k≤pk，這表示右式即為 a 除以 pk 的餘數：

amodpk=rk+(amodk)

注意到上式是 等號。由於 (amodk)<k，計算 r 的方法是直接將 rk+(amodk) 除以 k，商就是答案：

⌊krk+(amodk)​⌋=r+⌊kamodk​⌋=r

換句話說：

r=⌊kamodpk​⌋

回到原問題 ⌊kxy​⌋modp，根據上式可以得出：

⌊kxy​⌋modp=⌊kxymodpk​⌋

實作上，在計算 xy 的時候改成對 pk 取模，以避免 overflow。

但 pk 的最大值接近 long long 範圍的最大值，在快速冪的過程中需使用 __int128，才能避免兩數相乘時發生 overflow，得出錯誤的結果。

English Editorial

k=1 --- Binary Exponentiation

In class, we learned how to calculate xymodp in O(logy) time. For the subtask k=1 we can apply this method directly.

You can also find many related tutorial articles by searching "Binary Exponentiation" on Google.

The concept of binary exponentiation is to break down f(y):=xy into repeated subproblems solved recursively. Observe that f(y)=f(a)⋅f(y−a):

f(y)={f(⌊y/2⌋)⋅f(⌊y/2⌋)f(⌊y/2⌋)⋅f(⌊y/2⌋)⋅f(1)​if y is even,if y is odd.​

Obviously, there's no need to recursively compute f(⌊y/2⌋) twice, so it can be stored for direct use.

Binary Exponentiation - Recursive Version 
int fpow(int base, int exp, int mod) {
    if (exp == 0) return 1 % mod;
    int half = fpow(base, exp/2, mod);
    // return half * half % mod * (exp & 1 ? base : 1) % mod;
    if (exp % 2 == 0)
        return half * half % mod;
    else /// remember to take mod to reduce the maximum value during calculation ///
        return half * half % mod * base % mod;
    /*                     ^^^^^                                                  */
}

Here's another implementation that doesn't rely on recursion.

This implementation utilizes the binary representation of y, given by ∑i=0∞​2ibi​, where bi​∈{0,1}. This way, f(y) can be broken down into ∏i=0∞​f(2ibi​).

In C++, you can use y & (1 << i) to obtain bi​, and y >> i to get ⌊y/2i⌋. The example code continuously divides the exponent term by 2 using >>= 1 and extracts the "unit digit" value using & 1.

Binary Exponentiation - Binary Version 
int fpow(int base, int exp, int mod) {
    int ans = 1 % mod;
    while (exp) {
        if (exp & 1) ans = ans * base % mod;
        exp >>= 1, base = base * base % mod;
    }
    return ans;
}

Solution 1 --- Representing x as ak+q

To achieve a perfect score, an important observation needs to be made:

The multiple-of-k part doesn't matter when modulo p, but if the remainder part is taken modulo p, it will not contribute to the answer correctly.

Let's express the numbers to be multiplied as ⟨a,q⟩, representing ak+q, where 0≤q<k. Observe the result of multiplying two sets of numbers ⟨a,q⟩ and ⟨b,r⟩:

(ak+q)(bk+r)=abk2+(ar+bq)k+qr=(abk+ar+bq)k+qr(1-1)

This way, we can represent ⟨a,q⟩⋅⟨b,r⟩ as ⟨(abk+ar+bq)modp,qr⟩!

The final result ⟨a′,q′⟩ is then given by (a′+⌊kq′​⌋)modp.

However, when k>2, q′ might become very large, and we inevitably need to handle remainders in the calculations.

The remainder can once again be expressed as ck+s and contributes to the quotient, so (1-1) can be rewritten into the following equation:

(abk+ar+bq)k+qr=(abk+ar+bq+⌊kqr​⌋)k+(qrmodk)(1-2)

In other words,

⟨a,q⟩⋅⟨b,r⟩=⟨(abk+ar+bq+⌊kqr​⌋)modp,qrmodk⟩

This way, we also ensure that the remainder will be in the range [0,k), and the product of the two numbers will not exceed the range of a 64-bit integer.

Solution 2 --- Changing the Modulo

First, consider how to calculate ⌊ka​⌋modp, which is the remainder when ⌊ka​⌋ divided by p.

Assume that the quotient of ⌊ka​⌋ divided by p is q and the remainder of ⌊ka​⌋ divided by p is r, and what we are seeking is r.

⌊ka​⌋=qp+r(2-1)

According to the division theorem, we have

a=⌊ka​⌋⋅k+(amodk)(2-2)

Substitute (2-1) into (2-2):

a​=(qp+r)⋅k+(amodk)=qpk+rk+(amodk)​

To obtain r, note that

a≡rk+(amodk)(modpk)

Since rk+(amodk)<rk+k=(r+1)k≤pk, this means the right side is the remainder when a is divided by pk:

amodpk=rk+(amodk)

Note that the above equation is an equality. Since (amodk)<k, the way to calculate r is to directly divide rk+(amodk) by k, and the quotient is the answer:

⌊krk+(amodk)​⌋=r+⌊kamodk​⌋=r

In other words:

r=⌊kamodpk​⌋

Returning to the original problem ⌊kxy​⌋modp, according to the above equation:

⌊kxy​⌋modp=⌊kxymodpk​⌋

In practice, when calculating xy, it is modified to take modulo pk to avoid overflow.

However, the maximum value of pk is close to the maximum value of the long long range, and in the process of fast exponentiation, __int128 must be used to avoid overflow when multiplying two numbers, yielding incorrect results.

Solutions

Solution using x=ak+q 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

using i64 = int64_t;
using pii = pair<i64, i64>;

pii mul(pii a, pii b, i64 k, i64 p) {
    return {
        (a.first * b.first % p * k + a.first * b.second + a.second * b.first + a.second * b.second / k) % p,
        a.second * b.second % k
    };
}

pii fpow(pii base, i64 exp, i64 k, i64 p, pii ans = {0, 1}) {
    while (exp) {
        if (exp & 1) ans = mul(ans, base, k, p);
        exp >>= 1, base = mul(base, base, k, p);
    }
    return ans;
}

void solve() {
    i64 x, y, k, p; cin >> x >> y >> k >> p;
    
    cout << fpow({x/k, x%k}, y, k, p).first % p << "\n";
}

int32_t main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int t; cin >> t;
    while (t--) solve();
    
    return 0;
}
Solution calculating ⌊kxymodkp​⌋modp 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

using i64 = int64_t;
using i128 = __int128;

i128 fpow(i128 base, i128 exp, i128 mod, i128 ans = 1) {
    while (exp) {
        if (exp & 1) ans = ans * base % mod;
        exp >>= 1, base = base * base % mod;
    }
    return ans;
}

void solve() {
    i64 x, y, k, p; cin >> x >> y >> k >> p;
    
    cout << i64(fpow(x, y, k*p) / k % p) << "\n";
}

int32_t main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int t; cin >> t;
    while (t--) solve();
    
    return 0;
}

Expected / Reality

  • Difficulty: ★★☆☆☆
  • 100 points: 30 / 44
  • 85+ points: 35 / 50
  • 75+ points: 85 / 86
  • 10+ points: 90 / 86

F. Bad Sequence

  • Online Judge: 1625
  • Author: SorahISA

Problem Description

PDF

Given a sequence of n numbers a1​,a2​,…,an​. Define maxℓ,r​ as max{aℓ​,aℓ+1​,…,ar​} and minℓ,r​ vise versa, please count the number of pairs (ℓ,r) such that 1≤ℓ≤r≤n and (maxℓ,r​−minℓ,r​)+(r−ℓ)=k.

  • 2≤n≤500000.
  • 0≤k≤n−2.
  • 1≤ai​≤n for i=1,2,…,n.

Chinese Editorial

10 points --- O(n2)

直接暴力兩個 for 迴圈就做完了，這是 送分 兼 確認題目用 的子任務。

int ans = 0;
for (int l = 0; l < n; ++l) {
    for (int r = l, mn = A[l], mx = A[l]; r < n; ++r) {
        mn = min(mn, A[r]), mx = max(mx, A[r]);
        if ((mx - mn) - (r - l) == k) ++ans;
    }
}
cout << ans << "\n";

65 ~ 80 points --- 突破 o(n2)

想像你現在想找到左界 ℓ 在 [L0​,L1​] 之間、右界 r 在 [R0​,R1​] 之間的所有區間的答案（[L0​,L1​] 跟 [R0​,R1​] 沒有交集）：

如果算式變成 r−ℓ=k 要怎麼做，能不能在 O(R1​−L0​) 做完？

作法

簡單嘛，枚舉 ℓ∈[L0​,L1​]，檢查 ℓ+k 有沒有落在 [R0​,R1​] 就好了～

如果算式變成 maxℓ,L1​​−(r−ℓ)=k 要怎麼做？

作法

先把式子跟 ℓ、r 有關的分開，得到

maxℓ,L1​​+ℓ−k=r

對一個 ℓ∈[L0​,L1​] 而言，定義 costL​(ℓ)=maxℓ,L1​​+ℓ，只要 costL​(ℓ)−k 落在 [R0​,R1​] 就有一組解。

而 costL​(ℓ) 可以透過紀錄 a 從 L1​ 往前的最大值來做到 O(1) 維護。

Sample Code 
int solve(int L0, int L1, int R0, int R1) {
    int ans = 0;
    for (int l = L1, mx = a[L1]; l >= L0; --l) {
        mx = max(mx, a[l]);
        if (R0 <= mx + l - k and mx + l - k <= R1) ++ans;
    }
    return ans;
}

如果算式變成 (maxℓ,L1​​−minR0​,r​)−(r−ℓ)=k 要怎麼做？

作法

一樣把式子整理到兩邊，變成

maxℓ,L1​​+ℓ−k=minR0​,r​+r

右式雖然 不再是一個區間，但我們還是能透過先計算出所有合法的右界 costR​(r):=minR0​,r​+r 之後，再枚舉 ℓ 來找到答案。

需要特別注意的是 costR​ 中可能會有 重複 的數字（e.g., [4,2,3,1] 的 costR​(1)=costR​(3)=costR​(4)=5），此時，我們也需要 多次 計算到這些右界帶來的貢獻。

以下的實作方式是使用 std::map 來記錄 costR​ 裡的所有數字跟出現次數，在從 L1​ 到 L0​ 遍歷 ℓ 時便可以直接計算答案。

Sample Code 
int solve(int L0, int L1, int R0, int R1) {
    int ans = 0;
    
    map<int, int> costR;
    for (int r = R0, mn = a[R0]; r <= R1; ++r) {
        mn = min(mn, a[r]);
        ++costR[mn + r];
    }
    
    for (int l = L1, mx = a[L1]; l >= L0; --l) {
        mx = max(mx, a[l]);
        ans += costR[mx + l - k];
    }
    
    return ans;
}

如果算式變成 max(maxℓ,L1​​,maxR0​,r​)−(r−ℓ)=k 要怎麼做？

作法

一樣把式子整理到兩邊......

咦？好像整理不了了耶 QwQ

那能不能試著 分開討論 可能會出現的 case 啊？

  1. maxℓ,L1​​>maxR0​,r​：最大值出現在 [ℓ,L1​] 裡面；
  2. maxℓ,L1​​<maxR0​,r​：最大值出現在 [R0​,r] 裡面；
  3. maxℓ,L1​​=maxR0​,r​：兩邊都有最大值！？
    • 還是先考慮 a 是 1,2,…,n 的排列好了......

(1.) 跟 (2.) 本質上是相同的，只是左右對調而已，以下說明只講解 (1.) 的部分。

如果我們希望讓最大值出現在 [ℓ,L1​]，那就代表此時的 r 不能太大，不然可能會把一個超過 maxℓ,L1​​ 的數字加進右半邊。

但這樣對不同的 ℓ 都會有不同的 r 範圍，要怎麼做到快速的維護呢？

考慮到當你把 ℓ 往左移一步的時候 maxℓ−1,L1​​=max(aℓ−1​,maxℓ,L1​​) 一定只會變大，所以隨著 ℓ 往 L0​ 移動，合法的 r 的 右界 一定也只會 往 R1​ 靠近（左界一定固定在 R0​）。

於是，我們可以使用 two-pointer 來維護：用兩個變數分別記錄當前的左右界 (ℓ,r)，並在每次移動 ℓ 的時候都使用 while 迴圈檢查 r 能往右移動到哪裡。

既然我們已經知道最大值出現在 [ℓ,L1​] 裡面，那我們就可以把式子整理成第二個提示中的算式：

maxℓ,L1​​+ℓ−k=r

剩下的實作部分請參考 code。

Sample Code 
int solve(int L0, int L1, int R0, int R1) {
    int ans = 0;
    
    for (int l = L1, r = R0-1, mx = a[L1]; l >= L0; --l) {
        mx = max(mx, a[l]);
        while (r < R1 and a[r+1] < mx) ++r;
        if (R0 <= mx + l - k and mx + l - k <= r) ++ans;
    }
    
    for (int l = L1+1, r = R0, mx = a[R0]; r <= R1; ++r) {
        mx = max(mx, a[r]);
        while (l > L0 and a[l-1] < mx) --l;
        if (l <= -mx + r + k and -mx + r + k <= L1) ++ans;
    }
    
    return ans;
}

如果算式變回原本那樣要怎麼做？

作法

先忽略 (L1​,R0​) 範圍的東西。也就是說，我們現在要找到所有 (ℓ,r) pair 使得

(max(maxℓ,L1​​,maxR0​,r​)−min(minℓ,L1​​,minR0​,r​))−(r−ℓ)=k

繼續分 case：

  1. maxℓ,L1​​>maxR0​,r​ 且 minℓ,L1​​<minR0​,r​：最大跟最小值都出現在 [ℓ,L1​] 裡面；
  2. maxℓ,L1​​<maxR0​,r​ 且 minℓ,L1​​>minR0​,r​：最大跟最小值都出現在 [R0​,r] 裡面；
  3. maxℓ,L1​​>maxR0​,r​ 且 minℓ,L1​​>minR0​,r​：最大值在左邊、最小值在右邊；
  4. maxℓ,L1​​<maxR0​,r​ 且 minℓ,L1​​<minR0​,r​：最大值在右邊、最小值在左邊。

因為對稱性，以下只分析 (1.) 跟 (3.) 的 case：

在 (1.) 最大最小值都出現在 [ℓ,L1​] 的時候，我們可以得出跟上一個提示一樣的性質：

  • 隨著 ℓ 往 L0​ 移動，合法的 r 的 右界 一定也只會 往 R1​ 靠近（左界也一定固定在 R0​）。

在 (3.) 最大值在左邊、最小值在右邊的時候，我們也可以得出類似的性質：

  • 隨著 ℓ 往 L0​ 移動，合法的 r 的 右界 一定也只會 往 R1​ 靠近。

但注意到 r 如果取太小的話，最小值可能就會跑到左邊去了，也就是說此時我們也會需要維護 r 的 左界：

  • 隨著 ℓ 往 L0​ 移動，minℓ,L1​​ 會越來越小，所以 r 的 左界 也要 往右移動 到 minR0​,r​ 足夠小的位置。

實際上，可以觀察到 (3.) 裡 r 的左界其實就是滿足 minR0​,r​<minℓ,L1​​ 的最小的 r（記 r3​），而又 (1.) 裡的右界就是滿足 minR0​,r​>minℓ,L1​​ 最大的 r（記 r1​）：

  • r1​,r3​ 必定滿足 r1​+1=r3​。

於是我們可以在移動 ℓ 時同時維護 r1​ 跟 r3​，將 (1.) 跟 (3.) 的 case 合併處理。

回到原本關鍵的問題：要怎麼將所有 (ℓ,r) pair（1≤ℓ≤r≤n）分進一些沒有交集的 (L0​,L1​,R0​,R1​) 裡面？

俗話說：「有兩個 index 就很欠分治」，就來嘗試看看吧！

可以從 Lab 2 Problem B (happily) 的做法得到靈感：

每次將區間 [L,R] 分成兩半 [L,M] 跟 [M+1,R] 遞迴處理，這樣

  1. 如果 (ℓ,r) 都落在左半邊或右半邊就會被遞迴處理到。
  2. 如果 ℓ 落在左半邊、r 落在右半邊，就會被當下的函式處理到。
int solve(int L, int R) {
    int M = (L + R) >> 1;
    int L0 = L, L1 = M, R0 = M+1, R1 = R;
    
    int ans = 0;
    /* calculate answer */
    return solve(L, M) + solve(M+1, R) + ans;
}

這也解釋了為什麼上面會說「先忽略 (L1​,R0​) 範圍的東西」，因為 L1​+1=R0​，這個範圍根本就沒有東西啊！

至此，我們已經有了一個 T(n)=2⋅T(n/2)+O(nlogn)⟹T(n)=O(nlog2n) 的做法了！

Sample Code for Subtask 1, 3, 4: O(nlog2n) 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, K; cin >> N >> K;
    
    vector<int> A(N);
    for (int &x : A) cin >> x;
    
    int64_t ans = (K == 0 ? N : 0);
    
    function<void(int, int)> recur = [&](int L, int R) {
        if (L == R) return;
        int M = (L + R) >> 1;
        recur(L, M), recur(M+1, R);
        
        static vector<int> mn(N), mx(N);
        static map<int, int> cnt1, cnt2;
        mn[M] = mx[M] = A[M];
        for (int i = M-1; i >= L; --i) mn[i] = min(mn[i+1], A[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i+1], A[i]);
        mn[M+1] = mx[M+1] = A[M+1];
        for (int i = M+2; i <= R; ++i) mn[i] = min(mn[i-1], A[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i-1], A[i]);
        
        for (int l = M, r1 = M, r2 = M; l >= L; --l) {
            /// r1: last pos which mn[r1] and mx[r1] is between mn[l] and mx[l] ///
            /// r1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r = l - k + max - min] ///
            while (r1 < R and mn[r1+1] > mn[l] and mx[r1+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r1;
                ++cnt1[r1];
                --cnt2[r1 + mn[r1]];
            }
            /// r2: last pos which mx[r2] is below mx[l] ///
            /// r2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r + min = l - k + max] ///
            while (r2 < R and mx[r2+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r2;
                ++cnt2[r2 + mn[r2]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[l - K + mx[l] - mn[l]];
            ans += cnt2[l - K + mx[l]];
        }
        cnt1.clear(), cnt2.clear();
        
        for (int l1 = M+1, l2 = M+1, r = M+1; r <= R; ++r) {
            /// l1: first pos which mn[l1] and mx[l1] is between mn[r] and mx[r] ///
            /// l1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l = r + k + min - max] ///
            while (l1 > L and mn[l1-1] > mn[r] and mx[l1-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l1;
                ++cnt1[l1];
                --cnt2[l1 - mn[l1]];
            }
            /// l2: first pos which mx[l2] is below mx[r] ///
            /// l2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l - min = r + k - max] ///
            while (l2 > L and mx[l2-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l2;
                ++cnt2[l2 - mn[l2]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[r + K + mn[r] - mx[r]];
            ans += cnt2[r + K - mx[r]];
        }
        cnt1.clear(), cnt2.clear();
    };
    
    recur(0, N-1);
    
    cout << ans << "\n";
    
    return 0;
}

或許你有這樣的想法：「把 std::map 換成 std::unordered_map 就直接是 O(nlogn) 了耶，一定會跑比較快吧！」，但其實 std::unordered_map 的 常數非常大，往往跑的比 std::map 還要更慢。

任意的陣列 a

好吧，我們終究得面對 maxℓ,L1​​=maxR0​,r​ 的情況。

Or, do we?

對於任意相同的兩個數字 ai​,aj​，我們其實只需要把位置小的 在比較時 看成是 小一點點 的數字，就可以讓任兩個數字都不會被當成相同的值了！

  • 請試著想想看為什麼上面的計算不會爛掉。

更直接的，我們可以先將 a 以 (ai​,i) 重新編號 變成 a′，把 a′ 當成是 1,2,…,n 的排列，這樣就可以直接套用上面的做法了！

請仔細觀察下面 rk[] 的使用方式，mn[] 跟 mx[] 分別代表了什麼，以及思考為什麼在計算答案時要套上 A[]。

Sample Code for Subtask 1 ~ 5: O(nlog2n) 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, K; cin >> N >> K;
    
    vector<int> A(N);
    for (int &x : A) cin >> x;
    
    vector<pair<int, int>> A_sorted;
    vector<int> rk(N);
    for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) A_sorted.emplace_back(A[i], i);
    sort(begin(A_sorted), end(A_sorted));
    for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) rk[i] = lower_bound(begin(A_sorted), end(A_sorted), pair{A[i], i}) - begin(A_sorted);
    sort(begin(A), end(A)); /// use A[rk[i]] to find original A[i]
    
    int64_t ans = (K == 0 ? N : 0);
    
    function<void(int, int)> recur = [&](int L, int R) {
        if (L == R) return;
        int M = (L + R) >> 1;
        recur(L, M), recur(M+1, R);
        
        static vector<int> mn(N), mx(N);
        static map<int, int> cnt1, cnt2;
        mn[M] = mx[M] = rk[M];
        for (int i = M-1; i >= L; --i) mn[i] = min(mn[i+1], rk[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i+1], rk[i]);
        mn[M+1] = mx[M+1] = rk[M+1];
        for (int i = M+2; i <= R; ++i) mn[i] = min(mn[i-1], rk[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i-1], rk[i]);
        
        for (int l = M, r1 = M, r2 = M; l >= L; --l) {
            /// r1: last pos which mn[r1] and mx[r1] is between mn[l] and mx[l] ///
            /// r1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r = l - k + max - min] ///
            while (r1 < R and mn[r1+1] > mn[l] and mx[r1+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r1;
                ++cnt1[r1];
                --cnt2[r1 + A[mn[r1]]];
            }
            /// r2: last pos which mx[r2] is below mx[l] ///
            /// r2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r + min = l - k + max] ///
            while (r2 < R and mx[r2+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r2;
                ++cnt2[r2 + A[mn[r2]]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[l - K + A[mx[l]] - A[mn[l]]];
            ans += cnt2[l - K + A[mx[l]]];
        }
        cnt1.clear(), cnt2.clear();
        
        for (int l1 = M+1, l2 = M+1, r = M+1; r <= R; ++r) {
            /// l1: first pos which mn[l1] and mx[l1] is between mn[r] and mx[r] ///
            /// l1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l = r + k + min - max] ///
            while (l1 > L and mn[l1-1] > mn[r] and mx[l1-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l1;
                ++cnt1[l1];
                --cnt2[l1 - A[mn[l1]]];
            }
            /// l2: first pos which mx[l2] is below mx[r] ///
            /// l2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l - min = r + k - max] ///
            while (l2 > L and mx[l2-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l2;
                ++cnt2[l2 - A[mn[l2]]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[r + K + A[mn[r]] - A[mx[r]]];
            ans += cnt2[r + K - A[mx[r]]];
        }
        cnt1.clear(), cnt2.clear();
    };
    
    recur(0, N-1);
    
    cout << ans << "\n";
    
    return 0;
}

滿分解

雖然用 std::map 存很爽，而且很多諸如 陣列該開多大、會不會戳出陣列、要怎麼歸零 之類的問題都可以不用擔心，但他畢竟還是多了一個 O(logn) 的複雜度，所以我們還是要試著把他換成更好的資料結構。

  • 不，當然不是用 std::unordered_map。
觀察一下我們每次戳 std::map 的數值範圍是多少
  • r1：大概是 [0,n]
  • r1 + mn[r1]：大概是 [0,2n]
  • r2 + mn[r2]：大概是 [0,2n]
  • l - K + mx[l] - mn[l]：大概是 [−n,2n]（因為 mx[l] ≥ mn[l]）
  • l - K + mx[l]：大概是 [−n,2n]
  • l1：大概是 [0,n]
  • l1 - mn[l1]：大概是 [−n,n]
  • l2 - mn[l2]：大概是 [−n,n]
  • r + K + mn[r] - mx[r]：大概是 [−n,2n]（因為 mx[r] ≥ mn[r]）
  • r + K - mx[r]：大概是 [−n,2n]

其實根本只會戳到 [−n,2n] 範圍內的東西嘛！那我們根本就可以開一個長度 3n+1 的 std::vector 來取代 std::map，每次要 access 的時候直接平移 n 格用 vec[x + n] 就好了！

我們已經解決了「陣列該開多大」跟「會不會戳出陣列」的兩個問題了，但「要怎麼歸零」還是沒有解決。沒辦法直接用 for 迴圈歸零，也不能用 std::fill 或 memset 之類的手段（這些都要花 O(n) 的時間來歸零陣列，而不是 O(區間長度)），那我們要怎麼做呢？

我們可以 回～溯～時～間～

以上半段計算 Case 1 跟 3 的部分舉例：

  • 我們知道 cnt1[] 根本只會戳 r 的位置，
  • 我們知道 cnt2[] 也根本只會戳 r + A[mn[r]] 的位置，
  • 我們也知道 r1 跟 r2 最後的值是多少了，

所以我們可以在計算完 Case 1 跟 3 之後，把 r2 移回 r1、再把 r1 移回 M 的位置，並在移動的同時在 cnt1[] 跟 cnt2[] 上面反著 減一，如此就能在 O(R−L) 時間內清空一個區間了！

  • 請想想看，為什麼要先移動 r2 再移動 r1？
  • 時間複雜度：T(n)=2⋅T(n/2)+O(n)⟹T(n)=O(nlogn)。
  • 空間複雜度：O(n)。

English Editorial

10 points --- O(n2)

Simply use two nested for loops to iterate over all pairs of indices. This is a gimme task and serves as a verification task.

int ans = 0;
for (int l = 0; l < n; ++l) {
    for (int r = l, mn = A[l], mx = A[l]; r < n; ++r) {
        mn = min(mn, A[r]), mx = max(mx, A[r]);
        if ((mx - mn) - (r - l) == k) ++ans;
    }
}
cout << ans << "\n";

65 ~ 80 points --- Breaking O(n2)

Imagine you want to find all intervals where the left boundary ℓ is in [L0​,L1​] and the right boundary r is in [R0​,R1​] for all non-overlapping intervals [L0​,L1​] and [R0​,R1​]:

If the equation becomes r−ℓ=k, how can you solve it in O(R1​−L0​) time?

Approach

It's simple, iterate over ℓ∈[L0​,L1​] and check if ℓ+k falls in [R0​,R1​].

If the equation becomes maxℓ,L1​​−(r−ℓ)=k, what can you do?

Approach

Separate the expression involving ℓ and r to obtain

maxℓ,L1​​+ℓ−k=r

For a given ℓ∈[L0​,L1​], define costL​(ℓ)=maxℓ,L1​​+ℓ. There is a solution if costL​(ℓ)−k falls in [R0​,R1​].

The value of costL​(ℓ) can be maintained in O(1) time by keeping track of the maximum value of a from L1​ backward.

Sample Code 
int solve(int L0, int L1, int R0, int R1) {
    int ans = 0;
    for (int l = L1, mx = a[L1]; l >= L0; --l) {
        mx = max(mx, a[l]);
        if (R0 <= mx + l - k and mx + l - k <= R1) ++ans;
    }
    return ans;
}

If the equation becomes (maxℓ,L1​​−minR0​,r​)−(r−ℓ)=k, how can you solve it?

Approach

Similarly, rearrange the equation to

maxℓ,L1​​+ℓ−k=minR0​,r​+r

Even though the right side is no longer an interval, we can calculate all valid right boundaries costR​(r):=minR0​,r​+r first. Then, iterate over ℓ to find the solution.

Note that costR​ may contain duplicates (e.g., [4,2,3,1] with costR​(1)=costR​(3)=costR​(4)=5), so we need to calculate the contribution of these right boundaries multiple times.

The following implementation uses std::map to record all numbers and their occurrences in costR​. While traversing ℓ from L1​ to L0​, we can directly calculate the answer.

Sample Code 
int solve(int L0, int L1, int R0, int R1) {
    int ans = 0;
    
    map<int, int> costR;
    for (int r = R0, mn = a[R0]; r <= R1; ++r) {
        mn = min(mn, a[r]);
        ++costR[mn + r];
    }
    
    for (int l = L1, mx = a[L1]; l >= L0; --l) {
        mx = max(mx, a[l]);
        ans += costR[mx + l - k];
    }
    
    return ans;
}

If the equation becomes max(maxℓ,L1​​,maxR0​,r​)−(r−ℓ)=k, what can you do?

Approach

Similarly, rearrange the equation...

Hmm? It seems like it can't be rearranged, huh? QwQ

Can we try to discuss separately the possible cases that might arise?

  1. maxℓ,L1​​>maxR0​,r​: The maximum value is in [ℓ,L1​];
  2. maxℓ,L1​​<maxR0​,r​: The maximum value is in [R0​,r];
  3. maxℓ,L1​​=maxR0​,r​: Both sides have the maximum value!?
    • Maybe let's first consider a is a permutation of 1,2,…,n...

(1.) and (2.) are essentially the same, just with left and right swapped. The explanation below focuses on (1.).

If we want the maximum value to appear in [ℓ,L1​], it means that at this time, r should not be too large, or else we may include a number greater than maxℓ,L1​​ in the right half.

But how can we quickly maintain different ranges for r as ℓ moves left?

Considering that when you move ℓ one step to the left, maxℓ−1,L1​​=max(aℓ−1​,maxℓ,L1​​) will definitely only increase. Therefore, as ℓ moves towards L0​, the right boundary of valid r will only move closer to R1​ (the left boundary will always be fixed at R0​).

Thus, we can use a two-pointer approach to maintain: use two variables to record the current left and right boundaries (ℓ,r) and use a while loop to check where r can move to each time ℓ moves.

Now that we know the maximum value is in [ℓ,L1​], we can rearrange the equation into the same form as the second hint:

maxℓ,L1​​+ℓ−k=r

Refer to the code for the remaining implementation.

Sample Code 
int solve(int L0, int L1, int R0, int R1) {
    int ans = 0;
    
    for (int l = L1, r = R0-1, mx = a[L1]; l >= L0; --l) {
        mx = max(mx, a[l]);
        while (r < R1 and a[r+1] < mx) ++r;
        if (R0 <= mx + l - k and mx + l - k <= r) ++ans;
    }
    
    for (int l = L1+1, r = R0, mx = a[R0]; r <= R1; ++r) {
        mx = max(mx, a[r]);
        while (l > L0 and a[l-1] < mx) --l;
        if (l <= -mx + r + k and -mx + r + k <= L1) ++ans;
    }
    
    return ans;
}

If the equation returns to its original form, what can you do?

Approach

First, ignore the range (L1​,R0​). In other words, we want to find all (ℓ,r) pairs such that

(max(maxℓ,L1​​,maxR0​,r​)−min(minℓ,L1​​,minR0​,r​))−(r−ℓ)=k

Continue to split the cases:

  1. maxℓ,L1​​>maxR0​,r​ and minℓ,L1​​<minR0​,r​: Both maximum and minimum values are in [ℓ,L1​];
  2. maxℓ,L1​​<maxR0​,r​ and minℓ,L1​​>minR0​,r​: Both maximum and minimum values are in [R0​,r];
  3. maxℓ,L1​​>maxR0​,r​ and minℓ,L1​​>minR0​,r​: Maximum value is on the left, minimum value is on the right;
  4. maxℓ,L1​​<maxR0​,r​ and minℓ,L1​​<minR0​,r​: Maximum value is on the right, minimum value is on the left.

Due to symmetry, the analysis below only discusses cases (1.) and (3.):

In case (1.) where both maximum and minimum values are in [ℓ,L1​], we can obtain a similar property as in the previous hint:

  • As ℓ moves towards L0​, the right boundary of valid r will only move closer to R1​ (the left boundary will always be fixed at R0​).

In case (3.) where the maximum value is on the left and the minimum value is on the right, we can also deduce a similar property:

  • As ℓ moves towards L0​, the right boundary of valid r will only move closer to R1​.

However, note that if r becomes too small, the minimum value may end up on the left. Therefore, we also need to maintain the left boundary of r as ℓ moves towards L0​:

  • As ℓ moves towards L0​, minℓ,L1​​ will become smaller, so the left boundary of r must also move to the right to a small enough position relative to minR0​,r​.

In practice, it can be observed that in case (3.), the left boundary of r is actually the smallest r that satisfies minR0​,r​<minℓ,L1​​ (denoted as r3​), and in case (1.), the right boundary is the largest r that satisfies minR0​,r​>minℓ,L1​​ (denoted as r1​):

  • r1​,r3​ must satisfy r1​+1=r3​.

Therefore, we can maintain r1​ and r3​ simultaneously while moving ℓ, and reset them to r1​=r3​ after finishing Case 1 and Case 3. During the movement, decrement cnt1[] and cnt2[] in reverse order.

  • Think about why we need to move r2 before moving r1.

Now we have a solution with T(n)=2⋅T(n/2)+O(nlogn)⟹T(n)=O(nlog2n)!

Sample Code for Subtask 1, 3, 4: O(nlog2n) 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, K; cin >> N >> K;
    
    vector<int> A(N);
    for (int &x : A) cin >> x;
    
    int64_t ans = (K == 0 ? N : 0);
    
    function<void(int, int)> recur = [&](int L, int R) {
        if (L == R) return;
        int M = (L + R) >> 1;
        recur(L, M), recur(M+1, R);
        
        static vector<int> mn(N), mx(N);
        static map<int, int> cnt1, cnt2;
        mn[M] = mx[M] = A[M];
        for (int i = M-1; i >= L; --i) mn[i] = min(mn[i+1], A[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i+1], A[i]);
        mn[M+1] = mx[M+1] = A[M+1];
        for (int i = M+2; i <= R; ++i) mn[i] = min(mn[i-1], A[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i-1], A[i]);
        
        for (int l = M, r1 = M, r2 = M; l >= L; --l) {
            /// r1: last pos which mn[r1] and mx[r1] is between mn[l] and mx[l] ///
            /// r1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r = l - k + max - min] ///
            while (r1 < R and mn[r1+1] > mn[l] and mx[r1+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r1;
                ++cnt1[r1];
                --cnt2[r1 + mn[r1]];
            }
            /// r2: last pos which mx[r2] is below mx[l] ///
            /// r2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r + min = l - k + max] ///
            while (r2 < R and mx[r2+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r2;
                ++cnt2[r2 + mn[r2]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[l - K + mx[l] - mn[l]];
            ans += cnt2[l - K + mx[l]];
        }
        cnt1.clear(), cnt2.clear();
        
        for (int l1 = M+1, l2 = M+1, r = M+1; r <= R; ++r) {
            /// l1: first pos which mn[l1] and mx[l1] is between mn[r] and mx[r] ///
            /// l1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l = r + k + min - max] ///
            while (l1 > L and mn[l1-1] > mn[r] and mx[l1-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l1;
                ++cnt1[l1];
                --cnt2[l1 - mn[l1]];
            }
            /// l2: first pos which mx[l2] is below mx[r] ///
            /// l2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l - min = r + k - max] ///
            while (l2 > L and mx[l2-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l2;
                ++cnt2[l2 - mn[l2]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[r + K + mn[r] - mx[r]];
            ans += cnt2[r + K - mx[r]];
        }
        cnt1.clear(), cnt2.clear();
    };
    
    recur(0, N-1);
    
    cout << ans << "\n";
    
    return 0;
}

You might think, "Replacing std::map with std::unordered_map would make it O(nlogn), and it should be faster, right?" However, in practice, the constant factor for std::unordered_map is often larger than that for std::map, making it slower.

Arbitrary Array a

Okay, we ultimately have to face the situation where maxℓ,L1​​=maxR0​,r​.

Or, do we?

For any two identical numbers ai​,aj​, we can consider the position with the smaller index as slightly smaller when comparing. This way, any two numbers will not be treated as the same!

  • Please try to understand why the previous calculations won't fail.

More directly, we can renumber a as a′ using (ai​,i), treating a′ as a permutation of 1,2,…,n. Now we can directly apply the previous approach!

Carefully observe how rk[] is used, what mn[] and mx[] represent, and why A[] is used when calculating the answer.

Sample Code for Subtask 1 ~ 5: O(nlog2n) 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, K; cin >> N >> K;
    
    vector<int> A(N);
    for (int &x : A) cin >> x;
    
    vector<pair<int, int>> A_sorted;
    vector<int> rk(N);
    for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) A_sorted.emplace_back(A[i], i);
    sort(begin(A_sorted), end(A_sorted));
    for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) rk[i] = lower_bound(begin(A_sorted), end(A_sorted), pair{A[i], i}) - begin(A_sorted);
    sort(begin(A), end(A)); /// use A[rk[i]] to find original A[i]
    
    int64_t ans = (K == 0 ? N : 0);
    
    function<void(int, int)> recur = [&](int L, int R) {
        if (L == R) return;
        int M = (L + R) >> 1;
        recur(L, M), recur(M+1, R);
        
        static vector<int> mn(N), mx(N);
        static map<int, int> cnt1, cnt2;
        mn[M] = mx[M] = rk[M];
        for (int i = M-1; i >= L; --i) mn[i] = min(mn[i+1], rk[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i+1], rk[i]);
        mn[M+1] = mx[M+1] = rk[M+1];
        for (int i = M+2; i <= R; ++i) mn[i] = min(mn[i-1], rk[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i-1], rk[i]);
        
        for (int l = M, r1 = M, r2 = M; l >= L; --l) {
            /// r1: last pos which mn[r1] and mx[r1] is between mn[l] and mx[l] ///
            /// r1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r = l - k + max - min] ///
            while (r1 < R and mn[r1+1] > mn[l] and mx[r1+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r1;
                ++cnt1[r1];
                --cnt2[r1 + A[mn[r1]]];
            }
            /// r2: last pos which mx[r2] is below mx[l] ///
            /// r2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r + min = l - k + max] ///
            while (r2 < R and mx[r2+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r2;
                ++cnt2[r2 + A[mn[r2]]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[l - K + A[mx[l]] - A[mn[l]]];
            ans += cnt2[l - K + A[mx[l]]];
        }
        cnt1.clear(), cnt2.clear();
        
        for (int l1 = M+1, l2 = M+1, r = M+1; r <= R; ++r) {
            /// l1: first pos which mn[l1] and mx[l1] is between mn[r] and mx[r] ///
            /// l1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l = r + k + min - max] ///
            while (l1 > L and mn[l1-1] > mn[r] and mx[l1-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l1;
                ++cnt1[l1];
                --cnt2[l1 - A[mn[l1]]];
            }
            /// l2: first pos which mx[l2] is below mx[r] ///
            /// l2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l - min = r + k - max] ///
            while (l2 > L and mx[l2-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l2;
                ++cnt2[l2 - A[mn[l2]]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[r + K + A[mn[r]] - A[mx[r]]];
            ans += cnt2[r + K - A[mx[r]]];
        }
        cnt1.clear(), cnt2.clear();
    };
    
    recur(0, N-1);
    
    cout << ans << "\n";
    
    return 0;
}

Full Score Solution

Although using std::map is convenient and many issues like "how big should the array be", "will it go out of bounds", and "how to zero out the array" are not a concern, it still adds an additional O(logn) complexity. So, let's try to replace it with a better data structure.

  • No, it's not using std::unordered_map.
Observe how much we poke the std::map
  • r1: Roughly [0,n]
  • r1 + mn[r1]: Roughly [0,2n]
  • r2 + mn[r2]: Roughly [0,2n]
  • l - K + mx[l] - mn[l]: Roughly [−n,2n] (because mx[l] ≥ mn[l])
  • l - K + mx[l]: Roughly [−n,2n]
  • l1: Roughly [0,n]
  • l1 - mn[l1]: Roughly [−n,n]
  • l2 - mn[l2]: Roughly [−n,n]
  • r + K + mn[r] - mx[r]: Roughly [−n,2n] (because mx[r] ≥ mn[r])
  • r + K - mx[r]: Roughly [−n,2n]

Actually, we only need to access elements within the range of [−n,2n]. Therefore, we can replace std::map with a std::vector of length 3n+1. To access elements, we can simply shift by n and use vec[x + n].

We have addressed the issues of "how large should the array be" and "will it go out of bounds." However, we still need to solve the problem of zeroing out the array. We cannot directly use a for loop to zero out the array, and methods like std::fill or memset are not suitable since they take O(n) time to zero out the entire array, not O(interval length).

We can utilize a technique known as backtracking through time.

Consider the calculation of Cases 1 and 3 in the first half:

  • We know that cnt1[] only affects the position of r.
  • We know that cnt2[] only affects the position of r + A[mn[r]].
  • We also know the final values of r1 and r2.

After calculating Cases 1 and 3, we can move r2 back to r1 and then move r1 back to the position M. During these movements, we can decrement the values in cnt1[] and cnt2[] in reverse. This process allows us to clear an interval in O(R−L) time!

Think about why we need to move r2 before r1.

  • Time complexity: T(n)=2⋅T(n/2)+O(n)⟹T(n)=O(nlogn).
  • Space complexity: O(n).

Solutions

Solution by Algorithms TA 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, K; cin >> N >> K;
    
    vector<int> A(N);
    for (int &x : A) cin >> x;
    
    vector<pair<int, int>> A_sorted;
    vector<int> rk(N);
    for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) A_sorted.emplace_back(A[i], i);
    sort(begin(A_sorted), end(A_sorted));
    for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) rk[i] = lower_bound(begin(A_sorted), end(A_sorted), pair{A[i], i}) - begin(A_sorted);
    sort(begin(A), end(A)); /// use A[rk[i]] to find original A[i]
    
    int64_t ans = (K == 0 ? N : 0);
    
    function<void(int, int)> recur = [&](int L, int R) {
        if (L == R) return;
        int M = (L + R) >> 1;
        recur(L, M), recur(M+1, R);
        
        static vector<int> mn(N), mx(N);
        static vector<int> cnt1(4*N), cnt2(4*N); /// offset by 2*N
        mn[M] = mx[M] = rk[M];
        for (int i = M-1; i >= L; --i) mn[i] = min(mn[i+1], rk[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i+1], rk[i]);
        mn[M+1] = mx[M+1] = rk[M+1];
        for (int i = M+2; i <= R; ++i) mn[i] = min(mn[i-1], rk[i]), mx[i] = max(mx[i-1], rk[i]);
        
        for (int l = M, r1 = M, r2 = M; l >= L; --l) {
            /// r1: last pos which mn[r1] and mx[r1] is between mn[l] and mx[l] ///
            /// r1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r = l - k + max - min] ///
            while (r1 < R and mn[r1+1] > mn[l] and mx[r1+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r1;
                ++cnt1[2*N + r1];
                --cnt2[2*N + r1 + A[mn[r1]]];
            }
            /// r2: last pos which mx[r2] is below mx[l] ///
            /// r2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [r + min = l - k + max] ///
            while (r2 < R and mx[r2+1] < mx[l]) {
                ++r2;
                ++cnt2[2*N + r2 + A[mn[r2]]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[2*N + l - K + A[mx[l]] - A[mn[l]]];
            ans += cnt2[2*N + l - K + A[mx[l]]];
            
            if (l == L) {
                while (r2 != r1) --cnt2[2*N + r2 + A[mn[r2]]], --r2;
                while (r1 != M)  --cnt1[2*N + r1],             --r1;
            }
        }
        
        for (int l1 = M+1, l2 = M+1, r = M+1; r <= R; ++r) {
            /// l1: first pos which mn[l1] and mx[l1] is between mn[r] and mx[r] ///
            /// l1: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l = r + k + min - max] ///
            while (l1 > L and mn[l1-1] > mn[r] and mx[l1-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l1;
                ++cnt1[2*N + l1];
                --cnt2[2*N + l1 - A[mn[l1]]];
            }
            /// l2: first pos which mx[l2] is below mx[r] ///
            /// l2: [max - min - r + l = k] ==> [l - min = r + k - max] ///
            while (l2 > L and mx[l2-1] < mx[r]) {
                --l2;
                ++cnt2[2*N + l2 - A[mn[l2]]];
            }
            ans += cnt1[2*N + r + K + A[mn[r]] - A[mx[r]]];
            ans += cnt2[2*N + r + K - A[mx[r]]];
            
            if (r == R) {
                while (l2 != l1)  --cnt2[2*N + l2 - A[mn[l2]]], ++l2;
                while (l1 != M+1) --cnt1[2*N + l1],             ++l1;
            }
        }
    };
    
    recur(0, N-1);
    
    cout << ans << "\n";
    
    return 0;
}
Solution by Probability TA 
#ifndef Yamada
#define Yamada
#include Yamada __FILE__ Yamada

const int maxn = 1e6+5;
const int INF = INT_MAX;

int A[maxn];
vector<int> suf_mn(maxn+5, INF), suf_mx(maxn+5, -1);
vector<int> pre_mn(maxn+5, INF), pre_mx(maxn+5, -1);
vector<int> cnt(maxn << 1, 0), cnt1(maxn << 1, 0);

int gogo(int L, int R, int K) {
    if (L == R-1) return (K == 0);
    int M = (L + R) >> 1;

    for (int i = M - 1; i >= L; --i) {
        suf_mn[i] = min(suf_mn[i+1], A[i]);
        suf_mx[i] = max(suf_mx[i+1], A[i]);
    }
    for (int i = M; i < R; ++i) {
        pre_mn[i] = min(pre_mn[i-1], A[i]);
        pre_mx[i] = max(pre_mx[i-1], A[i]);
    }

    int ret = 0;
    int R_min = M, R_max = M;
    int mx = -1, mn = INF;
    for (int i = M - 1; i >= L; --i) {
        chmax(mx, A[i]), chmin(mn, A[i]);
        while (R_max < R && pre_mx[R_max] <= mx) {
            cnt[pre_mn[R_max] + R_max]++;
            R_max++;
        }
        while (R_min < R_max && pre_mn[R_min] >= mn) {
            cnt[pre_mn[R_min] + R_min]--;
            R_min++;
        }
        int R_target = mx - mn + i - K;
        ret += (M <= R_target && R_target < R_min);
        if (mx + i - K >= 0) ret += max(int(0), cnt[mx + i - K]);
    }
    while (R_min < R_max) cnt[pre_mn[R_min] + R_min]--, R_min++;

    int L_min = M-1, L_max = M-1;
    mx = -1, mn = INF;
    for (int i = M; i < R; ++i) {
        chmax(mx, A[i]), chmin(mn, A[i]);
        while (L_max >= L && suf_mx[L_max] < mx) {
            cnt1[suf_mn[L_max] - L_max + maxn]++;
            L_max--;
        }
        while (L_min > L_max && suf_mn[L_min] >= mn) {
            cnt1[suf_mn[L_min] - L_min + maxn]--;
            L_min--;
        }
        int tg = mn - mx + i + K;
        ret += (L_min < tg && tg < M);
        if (mx - i - K + maxn >= 0) ret += max(int(0), cnt1[mx - i - K + maxn]);
    }
    while (L_min > L_max) cnt1[suf_mn[L_min] - L_min + maxn]--, L_min--;

    for (int i = M - 1; i >= L; --i) {
        suf_mn[i] = INF, suf_mx[i] = -1;
    }
    for (int i = M; i < R; ++i) {
        pre_mn[i] = INF, pre_mx[i] = -1;
    }
    return ret + gogo(L, M, K) + gogo(M, R, K);
}

void solve() {
    int N, K; cin >> N >> K;
    for (int i = 1; i <= N; ++i) cin >> A[i];
    cout << gogo(1, N+1, K) << '\n';
}

signed main() {
    IOS();
    int t = 1; // cin >> t;
    for (int i=1;i<=t;++i) solve();
    return 0;
}

Lab 3

  • Date: 2023.11.01 18:00:00 - 2023.11.16 23:59:59
