A. Hero Wars

  • Online Judge: 1630
  • Author: 林律穎

Problem Description

PDF

Chinese Editorial

首先，將怪物們按照等級排序。

Subtask 2

考慮 q≤3000，每次詢問採取 O(n) 的複雜度是被允許的。

當你面對（剛好打不過）某個怪物，但等級比他低的怪物都打得過時，優先打等級最大或是最小的怪物會是最佳解？

當打怪升級到可以挑戰新的一批怪物時，要怎麼維護好目前還沒打的低等級怪物，又同時顧及新的一批怪物？

從初始狀態開始考慮，先把排序後的怪物分成打得過跟打不過兩區 [ℓ1​,r1​],[ℓ2​,r2​]。嘗試用簡易的資料結構維護當前打得過的怪物 [ℓ1​,r1​]，並且可以優先取得當前最適合挑戰的怪物（打得過的等級最高的怪物）。你會發現用 stack 可以達成這個效果，只要放怪物進去的順序有按照最優解的策略，則可以保證拿出來的怪物也會是當前最佳挑戰的怪物。

Sample Code 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

using int64 = long long;

const int64 INF = 1E16;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, Q; cin >> N >> Q;
    
    vector<int64> V(N), pre;
    for (int64 &x : V) cin >> x;
    V.emplace_back(INF);
    sort(begin(V), end(V));
    
    for (int q = 1; q <= Q; ++q) {
        int64 X, Y; cin >> X >> Y;
        
        stack<int> alive;
        int cnt = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i <= N and X < Y; ++i) {
            while (alive.size() and X < min(V[i], Y)) X += alive.top(), alive.pop(), ++cnt;
            if (X < min(V[i], Y)) { cnt = -1; break; }
            alive.emplace(V[i]);
        }
        cout << cnt << "\n";
    }
    
    return 0;
}

Subtask 3

xi​≥109 又 1≤vi​≤109，可知初始等級就可打敗所有的怪物。你能試著證明，優先挑戰等級最高的怪物，是最佳策略嗎？

先計算怪物等級的前綴和。

若從等級最高的怪物開始挑戰，則可以對排序後的怪物做二分搜，找到要挑戰的怪物區間（原怪物序列右半邊）。二分搜時可以用事先計算好的前綴和差，得知區間怪物等級加總，以利於二分搜。

Subtask 1

可以打倒 vi​ 時，表示 x≥vi​，打敗怪物後的等級為 x+vi​，又 x+vi​≥vi​+vi​≥vi+1​。由此可知只要初始能力值大於任何一隻怪物，就有能力挑戰完所有怪物。接下來要思考的是要以何種策略擊敗怪物，才可以在最小的次數達到等級 y。你能試著證明，優先往上挑戰等級較高的怪物，如果往上挑戰完，仍未達到目標 (x<y)，則再挑戰等級較低的怪物，是最佳策略嗎？

假設初始等級可以挑戰的最高等級怪物是 ℓ2​，可以把排序後的怪物分成兩個區間 [ℓ1​,r1​],[ℓ2​,r2​]。若可以藉由挑戰第二個區間達到目標等級，則對第二區間二分搜，找到要挑戰的怪物（第二區間左半邊）。若第二區間總和無法滿足目標等級，則挑戰完第二區間後，換成對第一個區間二分搜，尋找要挑戰的怪物（第一區間右半邊）。

Subtask 4

有一個簡單的想法是 greedy 找 ≤ 自身等級的最大值的怪物，直接實作是 O(qn) 甚至更糟。

考慮用陣列維護怪物活著的區間們 [ℓ1​,r1​],[ℓ2​,r2​],…,[ℓk​,rk​]，當前面對第 rk​+1 隻怪物的時候必定會從 rk​ 打回來。

  • 面對的定義是剛好打不過他。

由後往前檢查，哪一段區間裡面打完都還沒辦法超過 vrk​+1​（用前綴和），就直接一次打掉整個區間，直到找到某個區間，打完能挑戰下一個怪物，則對此區間二分搜，找到要挑戰的怪物（在原區間右半邊），並把原本的區間縮小到剩下的怪物（原區間左半邊）。

  • 如果打完所有人都沒辦法那就代表他失敗，輸出 −1。

接著就二分搜，「跳關」到下一個必須面對的怪物（可以當作有一個等級 ∞ 的怪物在最後面守著），並把「跳關」的區間加到維護的陣列裡面。重複前面的操作。

時間複雜度：O(qlognlogC+nlogn)。

  • Proof.

    假設這次面對的怪物是 a，則有當前等級 L<va​。

    前述維護區間的作法複雜度顯然是 O(number of intervals+logn)。

    二分搜並成長到能夠打敗怪物 a 之後，假設你下一個面對的怪物是 b，則因為 a<b 所以 a≤b−1 所以 L<va​≤vb−1​，此時只要打敗怪物 vb−1​ 就可以讓等級變成 L+vb−1​>2L。所以「跳關」的次數上界是 2logC。

    維護的區間數量只會在每次跳關時增加 1，所以區間數量上限是 2logC，但每個區間只要被刪掉一次（全部打完都沒超過 va​）就會消失了，所以詢問的複雜度是 O(qlogC+qlognlogC)。

    O(nlogn) 是一開始的排序。

Sample Code 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

using int64 = long long;

const int64 INF = 1E16;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, Q; cin >> N >> Q;
    
    vector<int64> V(N), pre;
    for (int64 &x : V) cin >> x;
    V.emplace_back(INF);
    sort(begin(V), end(V));
    partial_sum(begin(V), end(V), back_inserter(pre));
    
    auto sum = [&](int L, int R) -> int64 { return pre[R] - pre[L] + V[L]; };
    
    for (int q = 1; q <= Q; ++q) {
        int64 X, Y; cin >> X >> Y;
        
        vector<pair<int, int>> alive;
        int cnt = 0, lst = 0;
        while (X < Y) {
            int pos = upper_bound(begin(V), end(V), X) - begin(V);
            int64 goal = min(V[pos], Y);
            alive.emplace_back(lst, pos - 1);
            
            while (alive.size() and X + sum(alive.back().first, alive.back().second) < goal) {
                X += sum(alive.back().first, alive.back().second);
                cnt += alive.back().second - alive.back().first + 1;
                alive.pop_back();
            }
            
            if (alive.empty()) { cnt = -1; break; }
            
            auto [L, R] = alive.back();
            int lo = L, hi = R, mi;
            while (lo < hi) {
                mi = (lo + hi + 1) >> 1;
                if (X + sum(mi, R) < goal) hi = mi - 1;
                else                       lo = mi;
            }
            
            X += sum(lo, R);
            cnt += R - lo + 1;
            alive.back().second = lo - 1;
            if (alive.back().first > alive.back().second) alive.pop_back();
            
            lst = pos;
        }
        cout << cnt << "\n";
    }
    
    return 0;
}

English Editorial

Firstly, sort the monsters in ascending order of their levels.

Subtask 2

Consider q≤3000, and it is allowed for each query to have a complexity of O(n).

When facing a monster (just barely unable to defeat it), but all monsters with lower levels have been defeated, is it optimal to prioritize attacking the monster with the highest or lowest level?

When leveling up to challenge a new batch of monsters, how to maintain the lower-level monsters that haven't been defeated yet, while also taking into account the new batch of monsters?

Starting from the initial state, consider dividing the sorted monsters into two regions: those that can be defeated and those that cannot, denoted as [ℓ1​,r1​] and [ℓ2​,r2​]. Attempt to use a simple data structure to maintain the currently defeatable monsters within [ℓ1​,r1​] and prioritize obtaining the most suitable monster from this region (the highest-level monster that can be defeated). You will find that using a stack can achieve this effect, as long as the order in which monsters are placed into it follows the optimal strategy. This ensures that the monster taken out will also be the best.

Sample Code 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

using int64 = long long;

const int64 INF = 1E16;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, Q; cin >> N >> Q;
    
    vector<int64> V(N), pre;
    for (int64 &x : V) cin >> x;
    V.emplace_back(INF);
    sort(begin(V), end(V));
    
    for (int q = 1; q <= Q; ++q) {
        int64 X, Y; cin >> X >> Y;
        
        stack<int> alive;
        int cnt = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i <= N and X < Y; ++i) {
            while (alive.size() and X < min(V[i], Y)) X += alive.top(), alive.pop(), ++cnt;
            if (X < min(V[i], Y)) { cnt = -1; break; }
            alive.emplace(V[i]);
        }
        cout << cnt << "\n";
    }
    
    return 0;
}

Subtask 3

With xi​≥109 and 1≤vi​≤109, it is known that the initial level can defeat all monsters. Can you try to prove that prioritizing challenging the highest-level monster is the optimal strategy?

If starting from the highest-level monster, it is possible to perform a binary search on the sorted monsters to find the interval of monsters to challenge (original monster sequence's right part).

Subtask 1

When it is possible to defeat a monster with a level of vi​, it implies x≥vi​. After defeating the monster, the new level is x+vi​, and since x+vi​≥vi​+vi​≥vi+1​, it is evident that as long as the initial ability level is greater than that of any monster, one can challenge all monsters. The consideration is to determine the strategy to defeat monsters in the fewest attempts to reach level y. Can you attempt to prove whether it is the optimal strategy to prioritize challenging higher-level monsters first, and if after challenging them the target level (x<y) is still not achieved, then challenge lower-level monsters?

Assuming the highest-level monster that can be challenged at the initial level is ℓ2​, the sorted monsters can be divided into two intervals: [ℓ1​,r1​] and [ℓ2​,r2​]. If it is possible to reach the target level by challenging monsters in the second interval, binary search within the second interval to find the monster to challenge (left part of the second interval). If the sum of the second interval cannot meet the target level, then after completing the second interval, switch to binary search within the first interval to find the monster to challenge (right part of the first interval).

Subtask 4

A simple idea is to greedily find the monster with the maximum level ≤ its own level. However, direct implementation is O(qn) or even worse.

Consider maintaining intervals of alive monsters using an array, denoted as [ℓ1​,r1​],[ℓ2​,r2​],…,[ℓk​,rk​]. When facing the rk​+1-th monster, it must be defeated starting from rk​.

  • The definition of "facing" is just being unable to defeat it.

Check backward, and for a range where defeating all monsters within cannot exceed vrk​+1​ (using prefix sums), directly eliminate the entire range until finding a range where defeating it allows challenging the next monster. Then, binary search within this range to find the monster to challenge (on the original right half of the range), and reduce the original range to the remaining monsters (on the original left half of the range).

  • If it is impossible to defeat all monsters, output −1.

Then, perform binary search, "jump" to the next monster that must be faced (considering there is a monster with level ∞ guarding at the end), and add the "jumped" range to the maintained array. Repeat the previous operation.

Time complexity: O(qlognlogC+nlogn).

  • Proof.

    Assuming the monster faced this time is a, then the current level is L<va​.

    The complexity of maintaining intervals mentioned above is clearly O(number of intervals+logn).

    The binary search grows to be able to defeat the monster a. Assume the next monster faced is b, then because a<b, a≤b−1, so L<va​≤vb−1​. At this point, defeating the monster vb−1​ is sufficient to raise the level to L+vb−1​>2L. Therefore, the number of "jumps" is bounded above by 2logC.

    The number of maintained intervals only increases by 1 each time a "jump" occurs, so the upper limit on the number of intervals is 2logC, but each interval disappears as soon as it is removed once (all defeated monsters do not exceed va​), so the query complexity is O(qlogC+qlognlogC).

    O(nlogn) is for the initial sorting.

Sample Code 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

using int64 = long long;

const int64 INF = 1E16;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, Q; cin >> N >> Q;
    
    vector<int64> V(N), pre;
    for (int64 &x : V) cin >> x;
    V.emplace_back(INF);
    sort(begin(V), end(V));
    partial_sum(begin(V), end(V), back_inserter(pre));
    
    auto sum = [&](int L, int R) -> int64 { return pre[R] - pre[L] + V[L]; };
    
    for (int q = 1; q <= Q; ++q) {
        int64 X, Y; cin >> X >> Y;
        
        vector<pair<int, int>> alive;
        int cnt = 0, lst = 0;
        while (X < Y) {
            int pos = upper_bound(begin(V), end(V), X) - begin(V);
            int64 goal = min(V[pos], Y);
            alive.emplace_back(lst, pos - 1);
            
            while (alive.size() and X + sum(alive.back().first, alive.back().second) < goal) {
                X += sum(alive.back().first, alive.back().second);
                cnt += alive.back().second - alive.back().first + 1;
                alive.pop_back();
            }
            
            if (alive.empty()) { cnt = -1; break; }
            
            auto [L, R] = alive.back();
            int lo = L, hi = R, mi;
            while (lo < hi) {
                mi = (lo + hi + 1) >> 1;
                if (X + sum(mi, R) < goal) hi = mi - 1;
                else                       lo = mi;
            }
            
            X += sum(lo, R);
            cnt += R - lo + 1;
            alive.back().second = lo - 1;
            if (alive.back().first > alive.back().second) alive.pop_back();
            
            lst = pos;
        }
        cout << cnt << "\n";
    }
    
    return 0;
}

Expected / Reality

  • Difficulty: ★★★★☆

B. Intel CPU

  • Online Judge: 1631
  • Author: 楊秉宇

Problem Description

PDF

有 N 個區間 [L,R] ，每一個區間都有一個價值 vali​。從這 N 個區間選出一組區間集合，這組集合裡面的沒有任何一對區間沒有一個是有重疊的。如何選使得裡面區間的價值和越大越好。

There are N intervals [L,R], and each interval has a value vali​. Select a set of intervals from these N intervals, where no two intervals in the set overlap. How to choose to maximize the sum of values of intervals in this set?

Chinese Editorial

Subtask 1 & 3

所有價值 vali​ 皆為 1，題目等價於如何選擇使得集合裡面的區間數量越多越好。這個問題也被稱為 Activity Selection。

首先對於所有的區間依照 R 由小到大做排序。要讓選擇區間的數量越多越好，就代表盡可能選擇 R 越小的區間。

假設已選擇的區間集合最右端的值為 maxR ，現在要考慮一個區間 [Li​,Ri​]是否能加進集合，他能加進這個集合的條件為 maxR<Li​ ，加進去後 maxR 更新為 Ri​。我們還要在 [Ri​+1,∞) 找出一個組數量最多的區間集合，由於 Ri​ 是目前還沒被考慮過的區間 Ri​的最小值，因此 [Ri​+1,∞) 的範圍會是最大的，所以這樣排序方式會是正確的。

實作方式可以參考下面程式碼：

Sample Code 1 
struct Interval {
	int L, R;
};

bool compare_function(Interval x, Interval y) {
	return x.R < y.R;
}

int main() {
	// Sort the intervals in ascending order based on R
	std::sort(interval + 1, interval + 1 + n, compare_function);
	
	int max_R = -1; // Initially, no interval is selected
	int sizeOfIntervalSet = 0; // Final answer
	
	for (int i = 1; i <= n; ++i) {
		if (interval[i].L > max_R) {
			max_R = interval[i].R;
			sizeOfIntervalSet++;
		}
	}
}

Subtask 1 使用 O(n2) 氣泡排序 + O(n) 判斷能選的區間。總時間複雜度為 O(n2)。

Subtask 3 使用 O(nlogn) 使用 C++ 內建排序 + O(n) 判斷能選的區間。總時間複雜度為 O(nlogn)。

Subtask 2

現在考慮區間 [Li​,Ri​] ，令 [Li​,Ri​] 區間為區間集合 interval set S 的最右端 Ri​。透過貪心的想法，如果想要最大化 interval set S 的值，那我們要從所有的區間集合中選出一個最大的價值出來，且該區間集合的最右端在 [1,Li​−1] 。假設符合該條件的區間集合 interval set T，那麼 interval set S=interval set T∪[Li​,Ri​]， interval set S 的價值為 interval set T+vali​。

首先對於所有的區間依照 L 由小到大做排序。由於 L 是遞增的，所以只需要考慮前 i 個由區間 [Lj​,Rj​] (1≤j<i)且 Rj​<Li​ 的最大的區間集合價值。並且更新以 [Li​,Ri​] 為最右端， interval set S 的值。

程式的實作可以參考下面的程式碼：

Sample Code 2 
struct Interval {
	int L, R;
};

bool compare_function(Interval x, Interval y) {
	return x.L < y.L;
}

int main() {
	// Sort the intervals in ascending order based on R
	sort (interval + 1, interval + 1 + n, compare_function);

	long long intervalValueS[n + 1] = {};
	
	for (int i = 1; i <= n; ++i) {
		int mx = 0;
		for (int j = 1; j < i; j++) {
			if (interval[j].R < interval[i].L)
				mx = max(mx, intervalValueS[j]);	
		}	
		intervalValueS[i] = mx + value[i];
	}
}

複雜度 O(n2)。

Subtask 4

需要考慮的區間對於 [Li​,Ri​] 會是 [0,Li​−1]，由於 L 是遞增的，可發現最大值一定會是越來越大的。我們可以使用一個資料結構將儲存當前所有 Li​≤Rj​(1≤j<i) 的區間，若發現區間 Rj​<Li​ 將其移除這個資料結構，這個資料結構可以是用 set 或是 priority_queue ，並且最大值跟以 [Lj​,Rj​] 為最右端 ，interval set T 的值取。將區間 [Li​,Ri​] 存在這個資料結構裡面。

There are N intervals [L,R], and each interval has a value vali​. Select a set of intervals from these N intervals, where no two intervals in the set overlap. How to choose to maximize the sum of values of intervals in this set?

English Editorial

Subtask 1 & 3

All values vali​ are equal to 1, and the problem is equivalent to selecting a set of intervals to maximize the number of intervals in the set. This problem is also known as Activity Selection.

First, sort all intervals in non-decreasing order of R. To maximize the number of selected intervals, choose intervals with smaller values of R.

Assume the rightmost value in the selected interval set is maxR. Now consider whether an interval [Li​,Ri​] can be added to the set. It can be added if maxR<Li​, and after adding it, update maxR to Ri​. We also need to find the maximum number of intervals in the range [Ri​+1,∞), as Ri​ is the smallest value among the intervals not considered yet. Therefore, the range [Ri​+1,∞) will be the largest, and this sorting method will be correct.

The implementation can be referred to in the following code:

Sample Code 1 
struct Interval {
	int L, R;
};

bool compare_function(Interval x, Interval y) {
	return x.R < y.R;
}

int main() {
	// Sort the intervals in ascending order based on R
	std::sort(interval + 1, interval + 1 + n, compare_function);
	
	int max_R = -1; // Initially, no interval is selected
	int sizeOfIntervalSet = 0; // Final answer
	
	for (int i = 1; i <= n; ++i) {
		if (interval[i].L > max_R) {
			max_R = interval[i].R;
			sizeOfIntervalSet++;
		}
	}
}

Subtask 1 uses O(n2) bubble sort + O(n) to check intervals that can be selected. The total time complexity is O(n2).

Subtask 3 uses O(nlogn) with the built-in sort in C++ + O(n) to check intervals that can be selected. The total time complexity is O(nlogn).

Subtask 2

Now consider the interval [Li​,Ri​], and let [Li​,Ri​] be the rightmost of the interval set S. Using a greedy approach, to maximize the value of S, we need to choose the interval with the maximum value from all interval sets, and the rightmost of that set is in [1,Li​−1]. If there exists an interval set T satisfying this condition, then S=T∪[Li​,Ri​], and the value of S is T+vali​.

First, sort all intervals in non-decreasing order of L. Since L is increasing, only consider the maximum value of interval sets for the first i intervals, [Lj​,Rj​] (1≤j<i), and Rj​<Li​. Update the value of S with [Li​,Ri​] as the rightmost.

The implementation can be referred to in the following code:

Sample Code 2 
struct Interval {
	int L, R;
};

bool compare_function(Interval x, Interval y) {
	return x.L < y.L;
}

int main() {
	// Sort the intervals in ascending order based on R
	sort (interval + 1, interval + 1 + n, compare_function);

	long long intervalValueS[n + 1] = {};
	
	for (int i = 1; i <= n; ++i) {
		int mx = 0;
		for (int j = 1; j < i; j++) {
			if (interval[j].R < interval[i].L)
				mx = max(mx, intervalValueS[j]);	
		}	
		intervalValueS[i] = mx + value[i];
	}
}

Complexity is O(n2).

Subtask 4

The intervals to consider for [Li​,Ri​] will be [0,Li​−1], and since L is increasing, it can be observed that the maximum value will always be increasing. We can use a data structure to store all intervals with Li​≤Rj​(1≤j<i), and remove them from the data structure if Rj​<Li​. This data structure can be a set or a priority_queue, and the maximum value is taken from the interval set T with [Lj​,Rj​] as the rightmost. Store the interval [Li​,Ri​] in this data structure.

Solutions

Solution 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
#define int long long
using namespace std;

const int maxn = 5e5 + 5;
struct Line {
    int x, y, val;
};
vector<Line> line;

int ans[maxn] = {};
int32_t main() {
    ios::sync_with_stdio(0); cin.tie(0);
    int n;
    cin >> n;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        int l, r, x;
        cin >> l >> r >> x;
        line.push_back({l, r, x});
    }
    sort (line.begin(), line.end(), [](Line a, Line b) {
        return a.x < b.x;
    });
    priority_queue<pair<int, int>, vector<pair<int, int>>, greater<pair<int, int>>> pq;
    int mx = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        while (pq.size() && pq.top().first < line[i].x) {
            mx = max(mx, ans[pq.top().second]);
            pq.pop();
        }
        ans[i] = mx + line[i].val;
        pq.push({line[i].y, i});
    }
    cout << *max_element(ans, ans + n) << '\n';
}

Expected / Reality

  • Difficulty: ★★☆☆☆

C. Pecola or Treat

  • Online Judge: 1632
  • Author: 劉永福

Problem Description

PDF

一個賽程 (Schedule) 裡面包含多個決鬥 (Battle)，每次決鬥最多只能有 k 人參加，且有一位會進行之後的賽程。

定義一個賽程的成本 c(S′)=∑dS′​[i]×a[i]，其中 dS′​[i] 為第 i 參賽者在賽程 S′ 中，最多需要參加的決鬥數量。

你需要找到一個賽程 S ，使得 c(S) 是最小的。

輸出 c(S) 以及描述該賽程。

根據以上敘述，可以發現一個賽程等同於 k 元樹，每個參賽者可以視為葉子節點，而 dS​[i] 則是每個葉子節點的深度。

A schedule contains multiple battles, and each battle can have a maximum of k participants. Additionally, there is a subsequent schedule for the winner of each battle.

Define the cost of a schedule c(S′)=∑dS′​[i]×a[i], where dS′​[i] is the maximum number of battles participant i needs to attend in schedule S′.

Your task is to find a schedule S such that c(S) is minimized.

Output c(S) and describe the corresponding schedule.

Based on the description above, a schedule can be considered equivalent to a k-ary tree, where each participant is a leaf node, and dS​[i] represents the depth of each leaf node.

Chinese Editorial

Subtask 1

當 n=1 時，不需要進行決鬥就能決定出勝者， c(S)=0。

其餘狀況，因為 n≤k，所有參賽者都可以在一次決鬥中就決定勝者，且至少都需要進行一次決鬥，所以最小的 c(S)=∑ai​。

Subtask 2

仔細觀察題目的敘述，可以將 a[i] 視作 Huffman encoding 中的頻率，dS​[i] 視作編碼的長度。

那麼 k=2 就完全等同於有 n 個字元的 Huffman Encoding 問題。

因此，我們可以像講義中所提到的，將節點中頻率最小的兩個節點 x,y 挑出並組成一個新的節點 z，且其頻率為 x+y。不斷重複，直到節點數 ≤1 。

使用 priority queue 去找到並移除過程中最小頻率的兩個節點 x,y，再將新節點 z 放進去。這過程就等同題目的，挑選 x,y 進行決鬥，決鬥的勝者作為 z 進行剩下的賽程。

Subtask 3 & 4

接著將題目擴展到 k>2，一個直覺的想法是用跟 Subtask 2 一樣的操作，每次從 priority queue 裡面挑出 k 個權重最小的節點，將這些節點的總和作為新節點 z 的權重，最後放回 priority queue。

然而這樣做真的是最好的嗎？套用到 Sample Case 2，會發現得到的答案不是最佳解。 不過稍微觀察，會發現在 n≡1mod(k−1) 的時候 (Subtask 3)，直接挑權重前 k 小的能保證有最佳解。

接著進一步分析，對於最佳的賽程 S ( k 元樹 )，我們能有以下幾個 Claim

  • Claim 1: 所有深度不是最深的節點，其 Sibling 節點的數量必須為 k，且子節點要有兩個以上

    可以簡單地觀察出，如果不是的話，將深度更深的節點往上移可以使 c(S) 更小。

  • Claim 2: 對於任意葉子節點 i,j，若a[i]≤a[j]，則 dS​[i]≥dS​[j]

    類似地，如果不是的話，可以將兩葉子節點的位置交換，能使得 c(S) 更小。

  • Claim 3: 對於任意葉子節點，若將 i 移到同深度的其他位置，答案不變

    因為深度一樣，所以任意交換不會影響 c(S) 的結果

透過以上幾點觀察，試著猜出以下的 Greedy 演算法，並證明他是對的

Greedy Algorithm A 
A(a, k) // a is set of node()
	S := a
	cost := 0
	while |S| ≠ 1 :
			Z := new node()
			Z.childs := ∅ // set of node()
			Z.val := 0
			while |Z.childs| < 2 or |S| % (k - 1) != 0 : // at least 2 in one battle
					minNode := node with smallest val in S
					Z.childs = Z.childs ∪ minNode
					Z.val += minNode.val
					S := S - minNode
			cost += Z.val
			S := S ∪ Z
	root := the remained node in S
	return root, cost

證明固定一個 k，對於任意 n 個參賽者，我們用 A 做出來的賽程會是最佳解：

令 Hn​ 是用 A 做出來的賽程，Tn​ 是最佳賽程，我們想證明

c(Hn​)≤c(Tn​)∀a,k

我們可以使用歸納法

  • base: 1≤n≤k:
    • n=1，不需要進行比賽
    • n≥2，只需要一場比賽
    • 針對以上兩種狀況，A 顯然能做出最好的賽程。
  • induction: ∀n<l:c(Hn​)≤c(Tn​)⇒c(Hl​)≤c(Tl​):

    • 對於任意 n<l 的參賽者組合成立，我們都有 c(Hl​)≤c(Tl​)

    • 用反證法證明: 假設存在 Tl​:c(Hl​)>c(Tl​)

      • 我們可以根據Claim 1 & Claim 2 & Claim 3，將 Tl​ 轉成新的賽程 Tl∗​ ，在 Tl∗​ 中權重前 k′ 小的參賽者會參加一場決鬥，其中 k′=k−[(n−1)mod(k−1)]。且 c(Tl​)≥c(Tl∗​)

        令 y 為權重前 k′ 小的集合

        令 z′ 為權重前 k′ 小的總和

        令 a′:=a∪z′−y，∣a′∣=l−k′+1

        轉成賽程 Tl∗​ 後，我們能保證 Tl∗​ 一定會存在由 y 組成的一場決鬥；同樣地，按照 A 做出來Hl​ ，也一定會存在由 y 組成的一場決鬥。

        我們移除掉在 Tl∗​ 中，由 y 構成的決鬥，變成 Tl−k′+1∗​。可以得到滿足 a′ 的解

        直接用 A 對 a′ 做出來的賽程，我們稱為 Hl−k′+1​

        而我們知道 c(Hl​)=c(Hl−k′+1​)+z′;c(Tl∗​)=c(Tl−k′+1∗​)+z′，且因為 c(Hl​)>c(Tl​)≥c(Tl∗​)，所以我們可以推導出 c(Hl−k′+1​)>c(Tl−k′+1∗​)

        這與我們的假設 ∀n<l:c(Hn​)≤c(Tn​) 矛盾

      因此我們可以知道 c(Hl​)≤c(Tl​)

English Editorial

Subtask 1

When n=1, no battles are needed to determine the winner, and c(S)=0.

For other cases where n≤k, all participants can determine the winner in a single battle. At least one battle is required, so the minimum c(S)=∑ai​.

Subtask 2

By carefully observing the problem description, a[i] can be regarded as frequencies in Huffman encoding, and dS​[i] can be viewed as the length of the encoding.

For k=2, this is equivalent to the Huffman Encoding problem with n characters.

Therefore, as mentioned in the lecture notes, we can select the two nodes with the smallest frequencies, x and y, and create a new node z with a frequency of x+y. This process is repeated until the number of nodes is less than or equal to 1.

Use a priority queue to find and remove the two nodes with the smallest frequencies, x and y, and then insert the new node z. This process is equivalent to selecting x and y for a battle, and the winner continues in the remaining schedule.

Subtasks 3 & 4

Next, extend the problem to k>2. An intuitive approach is to perform similar operations as in Subtask 2. Each time, select k nodes with the smallest weights from the priority queue, use their sum as the weight of the new node z, and finally, insert it back into the priority queue.

However, is this truly the best approach? Applying it to Sample Case 2, we find that the obtained answer is not optimal. Yet, with a closer observation, it is noted that when n≡1mod(k−1) (Subtask 3), selecting the smallest k weights directly ensures the optimal solution.

Continuing with a more in-depth analysis, for the optimal schedule S (k-ary tree), we have the following claims:

  • Claim 1: For all non-deepest nodes, the number of sibling nodes must be k, and each node must have at least two child nodes.

    It can be observed that if this is not the case, moving a deeper node up can reduce c(S).

  • Claim 2: For any leaf nodes i and j, if a[i]≤a[j], then dS​[i]≥dS​[j].

    Similarly, if not, swapping the positions of the two leaf nodes can reduce c(S).

  • Claim 3: For any leaf node, moving it to another position at the same depth does not change the answer.

    Since the depth is the same, any exchange does not affect the result of c(S).

Based on the observations above, let's attempt to infer the following Greedy algorithm and provide a proof of its correctness.

Greedy Algorithm A 
A(a, k) // a is set of node()
	S := a
	cost := 0
	while |S| ≠ 1 :
			Z := new node()
			Z.childs := ∅ // set of node()
			Z.val := 0
			while |Z.childs| < 2 or |S| % (k - 1) != 0 : // at least 2 in one battle
					minNode := node with smallest val in S
					Z.childs = Z.childs ∪ minNode
					Z.val += minNode.val
					S := S - minNode
			cost += Z.val
			S := S ∪ Z
	root := the remained node in S
	return root, cost

To prove that for a fixed k, for any n participants, the schedule produced by algorithm A is optimal:

Let Hn​ be the schedule produced by A, and Tn​ be the optimal schedule. We want to prove that c(Hn​)≤c(Tn​)∀a,k.

We can use induction:

  • Base: 1≤n≤k:
    • For n=1, no competition is needed.
    • For 2≤n≤k, only one competition is needed.
    • In both cases, A can obviously produce the best schedule.
  • Induction: ∀n<l:c(Hn​)≤c(Tn​)⇒c(Hl​)≤c(Tl​):
    • For any combination of participants where n<l, we have c(Hl​)≤c(Tl​).
    • Prove by contradiction: Suppose there exists Tl​:c(Hl​)>c(Tl​).

      • According to Claim 1, Claim 2, and Claim 3, we can transform Tl​ into a new schedule Tl∗​, where the k′ smallest-weight participants participate in a battle, and k′=k−[(n−1)mod(k−1)]. Additionally, c(Tl​)≥c(Tl∗​).

        Let y be the set of the k′ smallest weights.

        Let z′ be the sum of the k′ smallest weights.

        Let a′:=a∪z′−y, ∣a′∣=l−k′+1.

        After transforming to schedule Tl∗​, we can guarantee that Tl∗​ will have a battle composed of participants from y. Similarly, according to A, the schedule Hl​ will also have a battle composed of participants from y.

        We remove the battle composed of y in Tl∗​, resulting in Tl−k′+1∗​. This provides a solution satisfying a′.

        By directly using A to produce the schedule for a′, denoted as Hl−k′+1​, we know that c(Hl​)=c(Hl−k′+1​)+z′;c(Tl∗​)=c(Tl−k′+1∗​)+z′, and because c(Hl​)>c(Tl​)≥c(Tl∗​), we can deduce that c(Hl−k′+1​)>c(Tl−k′+1∗​).

        This contradicts our assumption ∀n<l:c(Hn​)≤c(Tn​).

Solutions

Solution 
#include <iostream>
#include <vector>
#include <queue>

#define rep(i, a, b) for (int i = a; i < b; i++)
#define rrep(i, a, b) for (int i = a; i <= b; i++)
#define val first
#define idx second

using namespace std;
using ll = long long;
using pli = pair<ll, int>;

int main()
{
	cin.tie(0);
	ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0);

	int n, k, rating;
	priority_queue<pli, vector<pli>, greater<pli>> pq;
	/**************** input ****************/
	cin >> n >> k;
	for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
	{
		cin >> rating;
		pq.push({rating, i});
	}

	/**************** build schedule ****************/
	vector<vector<int>> battles;
	ll ans = 0;
	int nodeIdx = n;
	while (pq.size() != 1) // until only one member left
	{
		ll sum = 0;												 // value of the new battle
		battles.push_back({});									 // new battle
		while (battles.back().size() < 2 || pq.size() % (k - 1)) // put the k' smallest nodes into battles
		{
			pli node = pq.top();
			pq.pop();
			sum += node.val;
			battles.back().push_back(node.idx);
		}
		ans += sum;
		pq.push({sum, ++nodeIdx});
	}

	/**************** output ****************/
	cout << ans << '\n';
	cout << battles.size() << '\n';
	for(int i = 0; i < battles.size(); i++)
	{
		cout << battles[i].size() << ' ';
		for(int j = 0; j < battles[i].size(); j++)
		{
			cout << battles[i][j] << " \n"[j == battles[i].size() - 1];
		}
	}
	return 0;
}

Expected / Reality

  • Difficulty: ★★★☆☆

D. Thrill Factor

  • Online Judge: 1633
  • Author: 成俊宏

Problem Description

PDF

Chinese Editorial

Subtask 1

在這個子任務中，你只需讀入向量和矩陣，然後使用矩陣乘法計算答案，最後按照指定格式輸出原矩陣即可。以下是一個範例解法：

Sample Code 1 
using ll = long long;

int main() {
    // Input u, v, A
    
    // Calculate u^TA first
    // u^TA has the size of 1 x m
    vector<ll> uTA(m, 0);
    for (int i = 0; i < 1; ++i) {
        for (int j = 0; j < m; ++j) {
            for (int k = 0; k < n; ++k) {
                uTA[j] += u[k] * A[k][j];
            }
        }
    }

    // Calculate (u^TA)v
    // (u^TA)v has the size of 1 x 1
    ll val = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
        val += uTA[i] * v[i];
    }
    
    cout << val << endl;
    
	// Output the same u, v, A

    return 0;
}

Subtask 2

在 n=1 的狀況下，u 會退化為一個純量，A 會退化成一個向量，問題退化成二個向量內積之最大值。

我們可以任意排列這二個向量內的元素，所以我們可以直接暴力列舉所有可能的排列，並記錄最大值。複雜度會是 O((m!)2)。

不過內積的計算只和哪個元素對上哪個元素有關，所以其實可以固定某一個向量，只需要列舉另外一邊的排列就可以了。

我們可以使用 C++ STL 函式 next_permutation 來幫助實作所有可能的排列。

Sample Code 2 
using ll = long long;
struct Matrix {
  int n, m, val[15][15];
  Matrix() {
    n = m = 1;
    memset(val, 0, sizeof(val));
  }

  Matrix operator * (const Matrix &b) const {
    Matrix res;
    res.n = n;
    res.m = b.m;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
      for (int j = 1; j <= b.m; j++) {
        for (int k = 1; k <= m; k++) {
          res.val[i][j] += val[i][k] * b.val[k][j];
        }
      }
    }
    return res;
  }
};

int main() {
	// Input u, v, A
	// u is a scalar
	// A is a vector of size 1 x m
	ll maxVal = -1e18;
	vector<int> bestV;
	sort (v.begin(), v.end());
	do {
	    for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
	        V.val[i + 1][1] = v[i];
	    }
	    if (maxVal < (U * A * V).val[1][1]) {
	        maxVal = (U * A * V).val[1][1];
	        bestV = v;
	    }
	}while(next_permutation(v.begin(), v.end()));
	// out maxVal
	// out u
	// put bestv
	// out A
}

時間複雜度為 O(m!)。

以下引理，將用以得出更有效率的解法：

Lemma

If x1​≥x2​ and a1​≥a2​, then x1​a1​+x2​a2​≥x1​a2​+x2​a1​

Proof:

To prove this, just expand (x1​−x2​)(a1​−a2​)≥0.

這個引理告訴我們，當我們將大數字與大數字相乘，小數字與小數字相乘時，我們將得到更大的結果。

我們可以得出一個結論：若我們將這二個向量排序，讓大的數字對上大的數字，此時答案會有最大值。

請注意 u 的正負號對答案的影響。

Sample Code 3 
using ll = long long;

int main()
{
    // Input u, v, A
	// u is a scalar
	// A is a vector of size 1 x m

    ll max_val = 0;
    if (u > 0) {
        sort(A.begin(), A.end());
    } else {
        sort(A.rbegin(), A.rend());
    }
    sort(v.begin(), v.end());
    for (int i = 0; i < m; ++i) {
        max_val += u * A[i] * v[i];
    }

    cout << max_val << endl;
    
	// Output u, v, A

    return 0;
}

時間複雜度為 O(mlogm)。

Subtask 3

下面是將要求的答案轉換為數學式的步驟：

uTAv​=(uTAv)11​=i=1∑n​(uT)1i​(Av)i1​=i=1∑n​ui​(j=1∑m​Aij​vj1​)=i=1∑n​j=1∑m​(ui​Aij​vj​)​

當 u 中的元素都是 1 時，式子變為 ∑i=1n​∑j=1m​Aij​vj​。

一樣可以使用大數乘以大數，小數乘以小數的想法，先將 v 從大到小（小到大）排序，再將 A 從大到小（小到大）排序後，從填滿第 1 個 column 開始，依序填滿直至第 m 個 column。

Sample Code 4 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;
using ll = long long;

int main()
{
    // Input...

    vector<ll> A_flat(n * m);
    for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
            A_flat[i * m + j] = A[i][j];
        }
    }

    sort(v.begin(), v.end());
    sort(A_flat.begin(), A_flat.end());

    ll max_val = 0;
    for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
        for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
            A[i][j] = A_flat[j * n + i];
            max_val += A[i][j] * v[j];
        }
    }

    // Output...
}

這段程式碼將 A 展平為一維向量，然後將 v 和 A 進行排序。接著，根據排序後的 v 將 A 填充為新的矩陣，最終計算並輸出最大值。

複雜度為 O(nmlog(nm))。

Subtask 4

由於可以重新排列所有元素，大多數人可能會考慮首先將向量 u 和 v 排序，然後再考慮如何排列矩陣 A 以獲得最佳結果。

然後，你可能會遇到一個情況，即矩陣 A 的左上角元素將與向量 u 和 v 中的較大數字相乘，而右下角元素將與二個較小的數字相乘。但如果向量 u 和 v 同時包含正數和負數，那麼左上角的元素將與正的大數字相乘，右下角的元素將負負得正…與正的大數字相乘？

因此，這個子任務提供了一個簡化的情況，其中所有數字都是非負整數，這樣你就不必擔心這個問題。

理論上，你可以將矩陣 A 的左上角填充為較大的數字，右下角填充為較小的數字，這應該會得到正確的答案。但是，右上角和左下角的元素應該如何填充？

實際上，我們並不知道如何填充這些元素，但我們希望你可以通過這個子問題來思考：究竟向量 u 和 v 中的數字將如何影響我們填充矩陣 A 的數字。

Solution

再看一次答案的式子：

uTAv​=i=1∑n​j=1∑m​ui​Aij​vj​=i=1∑n​j=1∑m​Aij​(ui​vj​)​

由於 Aij​ 可以任意排列，我們其實可以固定住 u 跟 v，然後根據所有的 ui​vj​ 的大小來重排 A 中的數字，讓 A 中大的數字跟大的 ui​vj​ 對上。

實作上可以先預處理 ui​vj​所有的乘積，然後對 A 中的數字進行排序。

複雜度為 O(nmlog(nm))。

English Editorial

Subtask 1

In this subtask, you only need to read vectors and matrices, perform matrix multiplication to calculate the answer, and finally output the original matrix in the specified format. Here is an example solution:

Sample Code 1 
using ll = long long;

int main() {
    // Input u, v, A
    
    // Calculate u^TA first
    // u^TA has the size of 1 x m
    vector<ll> uTA(m, 0);
    for (int i = 0; i < 1; ++i) {
        for (int j = 0; j < m; ++j) {
            for (int k = 0; k < n; ++k) {
                uTA[j] += u[k] * A[k][j];
            }
        }
    }

    // Calculate (u^TA)v
    // (u^TA)v has the size of 1 x 1
    ll val = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
        val += uTA[i] * v[i];
    }
    
    cout << val << endl;
    
	// Output the same u, v, A

    return 0;
}

Subtask 2

In the case where n=1, vector u degenerates into a scalar, and matrix A degenerates into a vector. The problem then simplifies to finding the maximum value of the dot product of two vectors.

Since the order of elements in these two vectors can be arbitrary, we can brute force all possible permutations and record the maximum value. The complexity is O((m!)2).

However, the calculation of the dot product depends only on which element corresponds to which element. So, we can fix one vector and enumerate the permutations of the other side.

We can use the C++ STL function next_permutation to help implement all possible permutations.

Sample Code 2 
using ll = long long;
struct Matrix {
  int n, m, val[15][15];
  Matrix() {
    n = m = 1;
    memset(val, 0, sizeof(val));
  }

  Matrix operator * (const Matrix &b) const {
    Matrix res;
    res.n = n;
    res.m = b.m;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
      for (int j = 1; j <= b.m; j++) {
        for (int k = 1; k <= m; k++) {
          res.val[i][j] += val[i][k] * b.val[k][j];
        }
      }
    }
    return res;
  }
};

int main() {
	// Input u, v, A
	// u is a scalar
	// A is a vector of size 1 x m
	ll maxVal = -1e18;
	vector<int> bestV;
	sort (v.begin(), v.end());
	do {
	    for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
	        V.val[i + 1][1] = v[i];
	    }
	    if (maxVal < (U * A * V).val[1][1]) {
	        maxVal = (U * A * V).val[1][1];
	        bestV = v;
	    }
	}while(next_permutation(v.begin(), v.end()));
	// out maxVal
	// out u
	// put bestv
	// out A
}

The time complexity is O(m!).

The following lemma will be used to derive a more efficient solution:

Lemma

If x1​≥x2​ and a1​≥a2​, then x1​a1​+x2​a2​≥x1​a2​+x2​a1​

Proof:

To prove this, just expand (x1​−x2​)(a1​−a2​)≥0.

This lemma tells us that when we multiply large numbers with large numbers and small numbers with small numbers, we get a larger result.

We can conclude that if we sort these two vectors, aligning larger numbers with larger numbers, the answer will have the maximum value.

Note the impact of the sign of vector u on the answer.

Sample Code 3 
using ll = long long;

int main()
{
    // Input u, v, A
	// u is a scalar
	// A is a vector of size 1 x m

    ll max_val = 0;
    if (u > 0) {
        sort(A.begin(), A.end());
    } else {
        sort(A.rbegin(), A.rend());
    }
    sort(v.begin(), v.end());
    for (int i = 0; i < m; ++i) {
        max_val += u * A[i] * v[i];
    }

    cout << max_val << endl;
    
	// Output u, v, A

    return 0;
}

The time complexity is O(mlogm).

Subtask 3

Here are the steps to transform the required answer into a mathematical expression:

uTAv​=(uTAv)11​=i=1∑n​(uT)1i​(Av)i1​=i=1∑n​ui​(j=1∑m​Aij​vj1​)=i=1∑n​j=1∑m​(ui​Aij​vj​)​

When the elements of u are all 1, the expression becomes ∑i=1n​∑j=1m​Aij​vj​.

We can use the idea of multiplying large numbers by large numbers and small numbers by small numbers. First, sort vector v from large to small (or small to large), then sort matrix A from large to small (or small to large). Start filling from the first column and fill in order until all columns are filled.

Sample Code 4 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;
using ll = long long;

int main()
{
    // Input...

    vector<ll> A_flat(n * m);
    for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
            A_flat[i * m + j] = A[i][j];
        }
    }

    sort(v.begin(), v.end());
    sort(A_flat.begin(), A_flat.end());

    ll max_val = 0;
    for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
        for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
            A[i][j] = A_flat[j * n + i];
            max_val += A[i][j] * v[j];
        }
    }

    // Output...
}

This code flattens matrix A into a one-dimensional vector, sorts vectors v and A, and fills matrix A based on the sorted order. Finally, it calculates and outputs the maximum value.

The complexity is O(nmlog(nm)).

Subtask 4

Since all elements can be rearranged, most people might consider sorting vectors u and v first and then think about how to arrange matrix A for optimal results.

You may encounter a situation where the upper-left element of matrix A will be multiplied by the larger numbers in vectors u and v, while the lower-right element will be multiplied by the two smaller numbers. But if vectors u and v contain both positive and negative numbers, the upper-left element will be multiplied by the positive large number, and the lower-right element will result in a positive product as well. It sounds weird, right?

Therefore, this subtask provides a simplified scenario where all numbers are non-negative integers, so you don't have to worry about this issue.

In theory, you can fill the upper-left of matrix A with larger numbers and the lower-right with smaller numbers, and this should yield the correct answer. However, how should the elements in the upper-right and lower-left be filled?

In reality, we don't know how to fill these elements, but we hope you can think about how the numbers in vectors u and v will affect filling the numbers in matrix A through this subproblem.

Solution

Let's revisit the formula for the answer:

uTAv​=i=1∑n​j=1∑m​ui​Aij​vj​=i=1∑n​j=1∑m​Aij​(ui​vj​)​

Since Aij​ can be arbitrarily rearranged, we can actually fix u and v and rearrange the numbers in A based on the sizes of all ui​vj​ to align the larger numbers in A with the larger ui​vj​.

In practice, you can preprocess all products of ui​vj​, then sort the numbers in A.

The complexity is O(nmlog(nm)).

Solutions

By SorahISA 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

using int64 = long long;

int main() {
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(0), cin.tie(0);
    
    int N, M; cin >> N >> M;
    
    vector<int64> U(N), V(M), A(N*M);
    for (int64 &x : U) cin >> x;
    for (int64 &x : V) cin >> x;
    for (int64 &x : A) cin >> x;
    sort(begin(A), end(A));
    
    /// ans = sum_i sum_j u[i] * A[i][j] * v[j] ///
    
    vector<int> id(N*M), id_inv(N*M);
    iota(begin(id), end(id), 0);
    sort(begin(id), end(id), [&](int x, int y) {
        int rx = x / M, cx = x % M;
        int ry = y / M, cy = y % M;
        return U[rx] * V[cx] < U[ry] * V[cy];
    });
    for (int i = 0; i < N*M; ++i) id_inv[id[i]] = i;
    
    stringstream sout;
    int64 ans = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) sout << U[i] << " \n"[i == N-1];
    for (int j = 0; j < M; ++j) sout << V[j] << " \n"[j == M-1];
    for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
        for (int j = 0; j < M; ++j) {
            sout << A[id_inv[M*i + j]] << " \n"[j == M-1];
            ans += U[i] * A[id_inv[M*i + j]] * V[j];
        }
    }
    
    cout << ans << "\n";
    cout << sout.str();
    
    return 0;
}

E. The Path of Wealth

  • Online Judge: 1634
  • Author: 陳星宇

Problem Description

PDF

Editorial

Subtask 1

As n is very small, we can brute-force this subtask by traversing all the nodes to get the best answer and the corresponding path. The expected complexity is O(t⋅n!).

Subtask 2

Please refer to subtask 6.

Subtask 3

In this subtask, we can visit every node in the beginning, so we only need to determine the precedence of each node. There are only 18 kinds of nodes, consisting of {+1,+2,…,+9} and {x1,x2,…,x9}.

Suppose there are several nodes {p1​,p2​,⋯,ph​,m1​,m2​,⋯,mk​}, where pi​ denotes the value of node with '+' sign and mj​ denotes the value of node with 'x' sign. There are three possible scenarios to compare two arbitrary nodes:

  • pi​ vs pj​
  • wi​ vs wj​
  • pi​ vs wj​

(Define S as the initial value before doing the below operation)

Scenario 1:

  • If we do pi​ first then pj​, the value will be S+pi​+pj​.
  • If we do pj​ first then pi​, the value will be S+pj​+pi​.

We can find that the two approaches has no difference, indicating that the priority of arbitrary two addition nodes are the same.

Scenario 2:

  • If we do wi​ first then wj​, the value will be S×wi​×wj​.
  • If we do wj​ first then wi​, the value will be S×wj​×wi​.

We can find that the two approaches has no difference, indicating that the priority of arbitrary two multiplication nodes are the same.

Scenario 3:

  • If we do pi​ first then wj​, the value will be (S+pi​)×wj​=S×wj​+pi​×wj​.
  • If we do wj​ first then pi​, the value will be S×wj​+pi​.

We can find that the first approach will always be larger than or equal to the second one, so we can conclude that we always do addition first then do multiplication.

In summary, we can sort all nodes by performing addition followed by multiplication, and thereby identify the maximum value for the solution.

  • Note that the from this subtask on, the answer may exceed 1018, so you may use either double or __int128 to record the current answer, whenever the node value exceed 1018, record the value as 1018 and set the inf flag as true**.

Subtask 4

In this subtask, we know that every route has a multiplication node followed by an addition node. However, we cannot use the skill used in Subtask 3 as the addition nodes are "hidden" behind the multiplication node. Luckily, we can observe that whenever a multiplication node is visited, we will definitely visit its following addition node at once due to the conclusion derived in subtask 3 (as it is the only one addition node that can be visited at that time). Therefore, we can “merge” the two nodes in every route. Let’s take the following example:

As mentioned above, it is equivalent to visit a single node with ×3+6 when we choose the first route. So we can combine the original map into the new one below:

So here’s the next question, how to determine the precedence of each node?

Same as what we do in subtask 3, we can perform some computation:

  • {×a+b} vs {×c+d}

    • If we do {×a+b} first, then the value will be

      (si​×a+b)×c+d=(si​×a×c)+(b×c)+d

    • If we do {×c+d} first, then the value will be

      (si​×c+d)×a+b=(si​×c×a)+(d×a)+b

We can find that if (b×c+d)>(d×a+b), we will visit the previous node first. The formula can be further inducted into a relationship formula by rearranging items:

→→​(b×c+d)>(d×a+b)(c−1)×b>(a−1)×da−1b​>c−1d​​

We can calculate the comparing value of each node and determine the order, which is {×1+7},{×2+9},{×3+6}. Finally, the value will be

(((1×2)×1+7)×2+9)×3+6=87

In summary, we can sort all the combined nodes by the value of a−1b​ , Note that you have to deal with the edge case a=1 , which has the highest priority as the value of a−1b​ will be infinite. This also meet the conclusion we derived from subtask 3: “addition always has precedence over other nodes”.

  • Note that when you're implementing the compare function, please use the rule (c−1)×b>(a−1)×d instead, as a−1b​>c−1d​ might lead to wrong answer due to incorrect precision of floating point computation.

Subtask 5

In this subtask, each route might have several multiplication nodes, so it might be hard to decide which route to traverse if you only take the first merged multiplication node into consideration (since there might be a better merged multiplication hidden behind). We will introduce a little trick here. Just like what you did to merge addition node into multiplication node, we can also merge multiplication node into another one. Therefore, we can merge all the nodes into a single node in the order of a−1b​. So here’s the question, how to merge two merged multiplication nodes?

  • Merge {×c+d} into {×a+b}

    Which means you do {×a+b} first then do {×c+d}, the value will be

    (si​×a+b)×c+d=si​×(a×c)+(b×c+d)

    That’s right! you will find that you get a node with {×(ac)+(bc+d)}.

After you merge the two nodes, don’t forget to add this new node value into the priority queue to update its order (the comparing value of this node is ac−1bc+d​)

Let’s take the following example:

  • In the beginning, we calculate the comparing value of each node.

  • Merge node of value inf into its parent and reassign the parent of its child to its parent.

  • Recalculate the comparing value of each value and determine which node to be chosen. The merged node will be {×(2×3)+(0×3+9)}={×6+9}.

  • The next node selected should be node 1; however, it has nothing to merge, so we just simply ignore it. Instead, we take {×3+5},{×6+9},{×2} in order. Finally we will get a node

    (((si​×2+4)×3+5)×6+9)×2=si​×72+222

    , which is {×72+111}. Then we can calculate the answer 1×72+222=294.

Subtask 6

In this subtask, each mode might have several children nodes, so we need a data structure to record the children of each node (since if you iterate through all the nodes to get the children every time, you will get TLE). Here, we provide you a solution with adjacency matrix (which is an array of set). When you scan node 1 is the parent of node 2, you will insert 2 into array[1]’s set. This is helpful when you need to update a node’s children to its parent, as you only need to insert the set into its parent’s set.

Solutions

Solution 
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
#define i128 __int128
using namespace std;

typedef struct Node{
    int id;
    i128 mult;
    i128 add;
    vector<int> order;
} Node;

struct cmp{
    bool operator()(Node &a, Node &b){
        if(a.mult==1) return false;
        if(b.mult==1) return true;
        
        return a.add*(b.mult-1)<b.add*(a.mult-1);
    }
};

ostream& operator << (ostream &os, const i128 &x) {
    if (x == 0) return os << "0";
    i128 tmp = x;
    int sign = (tmp > 0 ? 1 : -1);
    if (tmp < 0) tmp *= -1;
    string ret;
    while (tmp) ret += char('0' + tmp % 10), tmp /= 10;
    if (sign == -1) ret += "-";
    reverse(begin(ret), end(ret));
    return os << ret;
}

i128 inf = pow(10, 18);

int main(){
    cin.tie(0);
    cin.sync_with_stdio(0);
    int t;
    cin>>t;
    while(t--){
        int N;
        cin>>N;
        vector<int> par(N+1);
        vector<set<int>> adj(N+1);
        vector<Node> nodes(N+1);
        priority_queue<Node, vector<Node>, cmp> pq;

        for(int i = 1;i<=N;i++){
            int node;
            cin>>node;
            par[i] = node;
            adj[node].insert(i);
        }
        for(int i = 1;i<=N;i++){
            char op;
            int co;
            cin>>op>>co;
            if(op=='x'){
                nodes[i] = {i, co, 0, {i}};
            }
            else{
                nodes[i] = {i, 1, co, {i}};
            }
            pq.push(nodes[i]);
        }

        vector<bool> traversed(N+1, false);
        traversed[1] = true;
        
        while(!pq.empty()){
            Node tmp = pq.top();
            pq.pop();
   
            if(traversed[tmp.id]) continue;
            traversed[tmp.id] = true;
   
            // merge current node with the previous one
            Node par_node = nodes[par[tmp.id]];
            Node tmp_node = nodes[tmp.id]; // this is the real tmp node, as when weights are the same, older node might come first in the pq
            
            par_node.mult = min(tmp_node.mult*par_node.mult, inf);
            par_node.add = min(tmp_node.mult*par_node.add+tmp_node.add, inf);
            
            nodes[par_node.id] = par_node; // update value of parent node

            if(par_node.id!=1) pq.push(par_node);
            
            // update children of current node to it's parent using adj matrix
            for(auto &i: adj[tmp.id]){
                par[i] = par[tmp.id];
            }
            adj[par[tmp.id]].erase(tmp.id);
            adj[par[tmp.id]].insert(adj[tmp.id].begin(), adj[tmp.id].end()); // insert children of this node to its parent
            nodes[par[tmp.id]].order.insert(nodes[par[tmp.id]].order.end(), nodes[tmp.id].order.begin(), nodes[tmp.id].order.end());
        }

        i128 ans = nodes[1].mult+nodes[1].add;
        if(ans>=inf){
            cout<<"infinite"<<'\n';
        }
        else{
            cout<<ans<<'\n';
        }
        for(int i = 0;i<nodes[1].order.size();i++){
            cout<<nodes[1].order[i]<<' ';
        }
        cout<<'\n';
    }
}
